item.title: Itaewon Freedom! - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Itaewon Freedom!

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

There is no 'impossibility' in this place, where different races and cultures mediated by their food and fashion are continuously mixed to produce another culture. In Seoul, South Korea, I headed to Itaewon to see the infinite freedom and taste of the world.
In college and vacation, there were motives for backpacking. They seemed to be 'freedom' themselves, leaving for adolescents who had to spend a vacation as a part-time job to save money for the next semester. It was also around that time that I dreamed of a wild dream of 'I'll see all the earth, water, and sky of the earth' through the wheels of reality. At the time, all I could do was lay out a map of the world and make a travel route, but even then, after looking around the globe a little, I felt like I wanted to leave anywhere.
Then one day, I realized the existence of 'he'. Itaewon, an island embraced by Seoul, Korea. It is said that there are more foreigners than Koreans, so you can enjoy food and culture from around the world as well as shopping, so you can enjoy the feeling of traveling abroad. Where else is this sweet temptation for a thirsty traveler? Eighty percent of the reason for leaving was to escape from reality and become a stranger. You can solve it with a single subway ticket. All you need is comfortable shoes and a map! Let's travel around the world in Itaewon, where you can reach right away whenever you want!
As you climb up the hill, a new world unfolds
Infinite freedom, the first attraction of Itaewon travel
Itaewon's Won originated from the fact that it was one of the four major stations for Hanyang travelers in early Chosun. It was a space from the beginning. In addition, during the Japanese colonial rule, the Japanese military headquarters entered, and after the Korean War, the US military base entered Yongsan and used 'Tarley Lee' and 'I-Ball Tae' to solve 'other children's neighborhoods'. did. The raw snags created by people being mingled and mingled are born as 'free space' that embraces 'time' and recognizes all kinds of 'diversity'.
Antique furniture street scene
There are buses heading to Itaewon, but here, we will introduce them to subways that are easier to find. You can get off at Itaewon Station on Subway Line 6, or at Hangangjin Station or Noksapyeong Station. If you are going for the first route, it is better to depart from Exit 3 of Noksapyeong Station, which connects to Itaewon-daero. Itaewon-daero is the real name of the main road that stretched out to the center of Itaewon. Let's call it 'Itaewon main street' here. Arched sculptures welcome Itaewon.
Antique furniture street scene
When you climb on the road, people of various skin colors appear in earnest. I'm looking at them walking comfortably in my salvation, so this is like a stranger. Where is this? Whose land is now walking on? But for a moment, as the nerves that became sensitive to various skin colors become more and more familiar, the song of UV that excited us some summer comes to mind. Itaewon Freedom, which is called in a space that allows infinite freedom that no one can interfere with!
Ewha Market Street, also called 'African Street'
Let's take a look at the map before the start of the trip to fully enjoy the freedom of chewy and sticky Itaewon. 'Itaewon Main Street' Centered largely 'Fashion · Islam · World Food · Antique Furniture · Africa (Ewha Market) Street' Things to see are split by the back. On the attached map of Itaewon, each street is labeled with a name. The street names may be slightly different, but it is unlikely that there will be a large crowd in conveying meaning by revealing the character in the name itself. Each street has its own characteristics, so you can choose according to your preference. It can be used for shopping and dining, and you can see even the 'Islamic culture', which is hard to find in the East.
Maps provided and Naver
Shopping and taste, the basics of Itaewon travel
When you come out of Exit 3 of Noksapyeong Station on Subway Line 6, you can see <Sujis>, who had a brunch in Itaewon. This is the 2nd floor of the <Hans Suit> building on the map. Itaewon Main Street, which extends coolly to the center of Itaewon, is at the back of <Itaewon Traditional Market> at the beginning of 'Itaewon Traditional Market', and horizontally the 'Fashion Street' spreads. Fashion and miscellaneous goods stores, including <Itaewon Underground Shopping Mall>, introduced as a treasure trove of fashion experts. Of course, there are road shops on the main street of Itaewon.
When you reach Itaewon Station along the main street, you can look around <Hamilton Hotel>. Behind <Hamilton Hotel> is 'World Food Street' where you can enjoy a round-the-world tour with 'flavor' 365 days a year. When you come out of Exit 1 of Itaewon Station and leave <KFC> to the right, go into the alley, and you can taste Indian cuisine from the front, starting with <Mugle>, where you can taste international cuisine.
Zelin on the World Food Street
Various restaurants are scattered all over Itaewon, but the first place to visit is the 'Itaewon gastronomy'. From <Santorini> where you can taste Greek food to <Selenium> where you can taste Bulgarian food.
Ask the staff slowly and choose what to taste
There are many pubs where you can enjoy food, simple yogi and beer. <Glam>, famous for its excellent water quality and atmosphere, is also located here. Earlier this year, Yongsan-gu announced an ambitious plan to revitalize this place as a 'special street for world food' and make it a tourist attraction.
Shirene shop ski baked with eggs on top of vegetables
The straight road facing <Hamilton Hotel> behind is 'Antique Furniture Street', where antique furniture stores are located. There is also a middle-sized relief store, so shopping enthusiasts continue to walk. You can get out of Exit 4 or 3 of Itaewon Station on Subway Line 6. From Exit 3, head towards the direction of Antique Furniture Street and turn left until you reach Ewha Market Street. It is also referred to as the 'African Street' because there are many African restaurants and hair shops.
Famous yogurt and cheese from Bulgaria
The place where the pole and various cultures of the pole coexist, here is Itaewon
Here, the crossroads you meet while going straight on are the starting points to embrace Itaewon's black past. If you keep going straight, you will come across the alley where the entertainment district against US troops was gathered when the US base was located in Yongsan. It is remembered under the name 'Hookers Hill'.
Islamic Central Masjid Road Scene
Turn right at the crossroads and the hilly path begins. Halal for Muslims (a product that Muslims are allowed to eat and use in the Islamic law) A restaurant and a transgender and gay bar are mixed casually.
Islamic Central Masjid Road Scene
'Islam Street', a path leading to the Islamic Central Masjid (Korea Islamic Central Assembly), curiously overlaps with entertainment establishments concentrated in 'Hookers Hill' and 'Gay Hill'. The symbol of conservativeness, represented by Hijab (Burca, Nicap, and Chador), which covers the face and body of women, is a border between the 'freedom' allowed by 'Itaewon', which is a place where entertainment centers that encompass Islamic culture and sexual minorities are well established. Paradoxes infinity.
Islamic Central Masjid
If you want to go right away, take exit 3 of Itaewon Station and turn right at the Itaewon Fire Station on the left. It will also be a good experience to stop by Tandoori and Curry shops filled with 'Islam Street' to taste their culture.
A little child I met at the Islamic Central Masjid
Turn left with Bogwang Elementary School in front of you and go straight ahead to reach the Islamic Central Support Center (Korea Muslim Central Association). Founded in 1976, Korea's first Islamic support is an indispensable space for traveling to Itaewon. White buildings, unique models and Arabic are eye-catching. There is a men's chapel on the second floor, a women's chapel on the third floor, and the Islamic school 'Prince Sultan' and a halal restaurant.
Indian fried rice, Bryani
Korean Muslim Central Conference ( http://www.koreaislam.org , 02-793-6908). This tour of Itaewon concludes by looking back to Islamic support. If you have lunch at <Hamilton Hotel>, try the Muslim taste at 'Islam Street' for dinner. Adding jjai and lasi to tandoori and curry, which we often know as Indian food, completes a hearty Muslim meal. Again, if you get only one ticket, the way back to reality opens.
Dip curry in rice or egg and eat
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

You can enjoy international cuisine from all over Itaewon. Therefore, the trip to Itaewon, except for 'Tourism Tour', is 2% short. You can soothe your thirst for travel by tasting food from a country that suits your taste or wants to go.
Sujis 02-797-3698 / American Brunch

Muggle 02-796-5501 / Indian & Pakistani Royal Cuisine
Zelen 02-749-0600 / Bulgarian Cuisine
Santorini 02-790-3474 / Greek Cuisine
Forrestrest 02-794-9292 / Indian and Arabic Curry & Kebab
Salam Bakery 02-749-4323 / Turkish Confectionery

2.Accommodation

Hamilton Hotel Itaewon-dong, Yongsan-gu / 02-3786-6000
Grand Hyatt Yongsan-gu Hannam-dong / 02-797-1234

item.title: If you dream of being an animation director or a cartoonist, you can call “Seoul Animation Center” - Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Seoul Animation Center Entrance

If you dream of being an animation director or a cartoonist, you can call “Seoul Animation Center”

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Every time one's dream is blurred, everyone remembers his childhood when he thought he wanted to become an animation director or cartoonist. When you visit the Seoul Animation Center, you can learn how to make animations that we didn't know, watch animations, and watch comic books until we get tired and go back to childhood.
Stop motion animation made by myself

The first thing to go to the Seoul Animation Center is a stop motion animation production experience. Let's start with the meaning of stop motion. After moving the object one inch at a time and repeating the process of shooting again, the video shows the moving effect of the object. If you make a character with clay (clay) and shoot it, it becomes 'Clay Animation', if you make a doll with various materials such as silicone or urethane, and you shoot it, it becomes 'Puppet Animation', and if you use any object as a character, it becomes 'Obje Animation'. Others include sand (sand) animations, which are sometimes seen on CF, and paper animations where a joint is drawn after drawing on paper.

Stop motion shooting scene
We make characters with clay and make videos by following the production principles of stop-motion animation, but not only children but also adults accompanying us are not happy.
Dooly Family Character
When you apply for the experience, you will be given a clay of five colors (red, blue, yellow, black, white). If you look around the experience room, there are many popular anime animation characters such as <Baby Dinosaur Dooley>, <Black Rubber God>, and <Pororo>. Choose the character you want to create, or start creating your own character.
Korea's top 100 characters diorama
If you want to model the exhibited characters, you can follow the instructions in order, referring to the information attached to the workbench.
Kioka character
By mixing five colored clays, you can create many different colors. When white is added to the basic color, it becomes a clay with a light tinge, and black to make a dark color.
Various characters
If you have completed your own character, go to the next set. There are also many types of miniature sets, such as car racetracks, white snow-covered polar regions, Pororo houses, soccer fields, and palm-sized beaches.
Kioka set
Choose one of them and put your own character. Moving the position of the character little by little, a total of 20 pictures are taken. At this time, you can create more interesting animations by appearing with the characters created by your friends or by decorating the story.
Bed room set
After taking a picture, he goes through the editing process of choosing a good picture. Subsequently, the names of the directors, any directors, and so on, will be given names. This time, my heart is thrilled that he debuted as an animation director.
Soccer field set field
In this way, if you upload 20 photos for 15 minutes and upload music that fits your mood to your own video, one stop motion animation is completed. After shooting, you can take your own character home.
Snow Country Set
Even if you don't have any experience, there are various character exhibits, exhibition halls, and animation theaters on the first floor of the Animation Center, so you can take a commemorative photo and watch a cartoon movie, so you can get in touch with it. The most recently created exhibition room, which is loved by visitors, is the Snowball World with Kioka. Trapezoidal paths for board games are made on the floor, and cute pictures of Kioka and friends live on the wall. If you look up at the ceiling with your head up, it seems that the big snowy eyes are going to pour down quickly.
Kioka's Snowball World Exhibition Hall
In the Animation Center, the secret restroom is the character bathroom. In the women's bathroom mirror, the background changes when the button is pressed, and flies fly to the display panel in the urinal of the men's bathroom.
Cartoon characters
Opposite the entrance to the bathroom, cartoon characters of memories such as Im Keun-jung, a primitive boy Toby, and a medallion of Meong-seo-dang, born by famous cartoonists such as Doo-ho Lee, Shin-su Lee, and Seung-woon Yun, enter the clean frame instead of inside a comic book to greet visitors.
Yoon Seung-woon's cartoon characters
Plop into the world of cartoons
If you go out of the stop motion animation production experience and go to the building on the right, it is a manga museum with a signboard of 'Manga House'. It is a must-visit spot for manga enthusiasts. The first floor consisted of a library information room and the second floor consisted of an animatronic zone. If you leave with your ID card, you can fall into the reading scene without any interference from 9 am to 6 pm (but Mondays and legal holidays are closed).
Library Information Room Landscape
The Book Information Room, located on the first floor, is a small library that holds more than 40,000 books related to cultural contents such as cartoons, animations, games and characters from foreign countries as well as cartoons published in Korea. It can be read only in the library information room, and external loans are not permitted. If you look at the viewers passing through the bookshelves while breathtakingly standing in various places in a comfortable position, I'd like to say, 'There is a calm place in the middle of Seoul'.
Cartoon staring girl
Anytoon Zone has over 7,000 video materials, including domestic and foreign cartoons and animation-related videos and DVDs. You can borrow materials and watch them in one-person or two-person screenings. In particular, two-person screenings are great for lovers to sit side by side and appreciate the work. A group of 10 or more people (about 30-40 people) will be provided with a mini theater. Also, on the weekends, the animation works are shown 2-3 times a day in a regular screening format.
Annie Toon John's Video Watching Room
At the entrance of the Anytoon Zone, be sure to take a look at the old manga room scenery decorated with paper dolls. Elementary school students reading comic books around briquette stoves, middle school students choosing comic books from school uniforms in uniforms, uncles who sneak into the rocks at the creek, and children who pass the bookshelf to sell in the shade of trees ... If you try to open one by one, the old thoughts come to mind and laughs. 'Oh, I was so happy back then.'
Old cartoon room
Travel information

<Seoul Animation Center>
Address: Yejang-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul (126 Sopa-ro)
Contact: 02-3455-8341
home page : www.ani.seoul.kr

item.title: A unique alleyway ‘Munrae Art Village’ where an iron man and an artist coexist - Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Seoul scenery over the Han River

A unique alleyway ‘Munrae Art Village’ where an iron man and an artist coexist

Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea

There are a lot of buildings and apartments when you walk around the Han River and look around. Excluding the ridges of Mt. I hope that the Bukhansan Mountain is not covered by the building. When you escape from the Han River, the scenery of the low world, which was hidden in the big building, unfolds. The sidewalk block is stuck like a ruler and the square sign is dizzy.

Flyers such as lodging, rent, charter, and Gosiwon are posted on the alleys of a university town. Alleys with a high smell of people are better than the monotony of building forests. Suddenly, memories of Munrae-dong are revived. "Jiing ~" The sound of iron splitting, the mural on the alleyway that you don't know who drew it, the dazzling Daegutang ... , I looked back on the journey.

From Exit 2 of Munrae Station on the Seoul Subway Line 2, go straight for about 200m, and there is a junction of 128 roads between Dangsan-ro and Dorim-ro. You can easily find direction signs and signs related to the Munrae Art Village in the vicinity. Based on Dorim-ro 128-gil, the high-rise building area and the low-rise building area have different atmospheres. This itinerary is a course that walks around the area with mostly low buildings.

The place where the alleyway begins is the famous seat of mural

Munrae-dong is a place where the relationship with the factory deepened as a spinning factory entered during the Japanese occupation. At that time, the spinning machine was called 'Mullae', and the place's name, 'Moonrae-dong' was said to have been established. Since then, steel factories and iron statues have been concentrated here, and now artists are flocking to this place, where art and ironworks coexist.

Walking using the map app on your smartphone is only in the early stages. If you see an alley next to the ironworks, you can go through the other side and enter the alley again. Even if you go back to the alley you came from, the fun is more intense than the embarrassment.

Booth at the point where Dangsan-ro and Dorim-ro meet 128

Outside the alleys, murals are drawn without any rules or entanglements in a space where the proper words do not come up. It might be an unexpected scenery. Whenever I walk down an alley and turn my body toward the bent, I can feel like stopping at this sudden stop several times. It would be okay to call it a museum without a roof.

mural
mural
mural

It would not be an order to skip the story of the past where there could be a current Munrae-dong and take it in an alley atmosphere. Let's take a brief look at the past years here. Seoul's old industrial complex is a trace of modernization, where the industry began to prefer treatment over agriculture. In the 70s, where factories were more concentrated than now, Munrae-dong was a world of workers, machinery and iron. So far, the scenery of the world remains in every corner of the alley. On top of that, someone drew a brush and colored it. It would be a moment when the artist's hand began to transform into a unique neighborhood rather than a common neighborhood in Seoul.

If you listen a little to the back of the mural, you can hear the harsh breath and the smell of sweat. The energy of iron that fills the alley, "Jieing ~" The creepy sound of iron grinding "Bang!" The sound of heavy iron bumps through the alley without even attempting it. It is a space where wild nature and weeds coexist.

The reputation of the old Mullae-dong steel mill was rusted.

On the one side of a sunny alley, the clothes are roughly lined with wrinkles left over from the woven traces. The color of the clothes has faded, and the cotton gloves are open to seams. There is a shabby pajeon in the corner of the alley. Makgeolli here would have cooled the night of those who spent the day hot with iron.

Tough jeans fit well in this alley

How did Moonrae-dong, the mecca of the steel industry, now become famous for the Moonrae Art Village? In the late 80s and early 90s, Munrae-dong was one of the most serious areas of air pollution in Korea. In line with this period, the city of Seoul attempted to move the steel sales districts around Munrae-dong and Dorim-dong to the outskirts. Since then, the steel industry in Munrae-dong has gradually declined and the number of vacancy has increased. Around the same time, artists who were looking for inexpensive work spaces began to fill the empty spaces here. Currently, there are about 100 workshops in Munrae-dong and about 200 artists are active, but the issue of redevelopment is said to be reducing the scope of the artist's activity as it reaches the Moonrae-dong.

radish
A deer walks on a gray fence that would be colorless and odorless

Based on the Yangnam Intersection, let's turn to the northeast block and then cross the southeast block. Mural paintings are also painted on the backside of the post office in Munrae-dong and in a dense alleyway. In some murals, the feeling was so intense that I had to look for a while, and in some murals, I felt like a graffiti on my desk as a child. While looking at the murals, each element of the alleyway approaches meaningfully. The atmosphere of this place, such as green water flowing over cement, broken tiles, and small simple doors, has a rather rough texture.

The padding and padding will crack as time goes by.
One of the murals that impressed me

My heart gets eaten before I press the camera shutter. The scenery that came into my eyes through the viewfinder was like the wrinkles of the swings that happened again even though I lived and wasted. . Nevertheless, the reason to remember Munrae-dong with warmth and brightness is that a child with a smile and a light step was holding flowers in a mural, and the door in the mural painting the village was wide open.

mural
mural

There is a Daegutang specialty store (Moonrae Daegutang) to decorate the beauty of this journey by going west from Munrae Post Office and crossing the southwest block of the Mullae Park intersection. The moon tastes like Daegu and Munrae Daegu-tang, which were in season when Munrae-dong was suddenly remembered. The menu that the reporter enjoys is Daegu Gonitang, which has spicy soup and hearty Goni.

Daegu Gonitang in Munrae Daegu Bath House

How long it has been since I pledged the New Year's pledge, my feelings have faded and aesthetically pleasing. As I walk in the Han River Dunchi, I hope that the space of coexistence of iron and art and workers and artists in the Mullae Art Village will continue to look like the hope of continuing to see the Bukhansan Mountain.

Daegu Gonitang in Munrae Daegu Bath House
Exit tips
1. It is good to use weekends and holidays when iron workshops and steel malls are closed. On the day off, you can see the pictures drawn on the shutters that fall down, and it's more suitable for weekends than on weekdays for leisurely walking around.
2. If you want to put a mural on a narrow alley, take a wide-angle lens. Smartphones with a panorama function are also useful.
3. You can access information related to artists' exhibitions and events at nearby cafes.
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Yeomui-daero IC of Olympic-daero (To Yeongdeungpo Rotary) → Yeongdeungpo Station → Munrae-dong Intersection (turn right to Yanghwadaegyo Bridge, Yangnamseo Street) → Yangnam Intersection

* public transport

Seoul Subway Line 2 Munrae Station Exit 7 → Go straight 200m → Munrae Art Village

2. Delicious

Mullae Daegutang: Daegutang, 02-2633-5529
English / Japanese style: Kalguksu, 02-2636-9817
Garlic Whole Chicken: Whole Chicken, 02-2637-3480

3.Accommodation

M Hotel: Yeouido-dong, Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, 02-783-2271
Petra Hotel Motel: Yeongdeungpo-dong 3-ga, Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul 02-2631-6686
Yeongdeungpo Tourist Hotel: 02-2678-4265, Dangsan-dong 5-ga, Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul
Sejong Motel: Yangpyeong-dong 1-ga, Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, 02-2633-2838

item.title: We invite you to the playground in the nearby forest! Seoul Children's Forest Experience Center 3 - Geumcheon-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Children playing grasshopper at the toddler forest experience

We invite you to the playground in the nearby forest! Seoul Children's Forest Experience Center 3

Geumcheon-gu, Seoul, Korea

Children play well with sand or even a few branches. When a child sits on the ground or crawls after an ant, the parents become furious. I hate to get my clothes dirty, and I wonder if the germs may move. So, these days, kids spend time inside their homes, or at best, play in kids cafes and indoor playgrounds. It is the wish of every parent that a child grows up healthy. If you want your body and mind to be healthy and grow up in nature, you need to let them play in nature, not artificial amusement facilities. Children make play by using all kinds of creative methods even with simple natural objects. Stepping on the soil, smelling wild flowers, and playing in the woods, where you can feel the warmth of the trees, is close by.

In Seoul, an infant forest experience center is being created one by one. In order to create an environment where children can play in the arms of nature and grow up healthy, they made a playground in the forest that fits the eye level of children by using small and large forests in the neighborhood. Since opening the first infant forest experience site in 2012 at Cheongnyongsan Mountain in Gwanak-gu, Ujangsan Mountain in Gangseo-gu, and Maebongsan Mountain in Yongsan-gu, Doksan-dong, Geumcheon-gu, Odong Neighborhood Park in Gangbuk-gu, Baebongsan Mountain in Dongdaemun-gu, Gaeunsan Mountain in Seongbuk-gu, Suwonsan Mountain in Nowon-gu, Nanji Park in Songpa-gu, Namsan Park in Songpa-gu It was opened following the Samcheong Park in Jongno-gu. Currently, it operates the most 41 locations in the country.
Grasshopper entrance to infant forest experience
Groups come from kindergartens and daycare centers on weekdays and families on weekends. In addition to Seoul, there are a total of 31 infant forest experience centers in Busan, as well as an infant forest experience center under the Forest Service.
The only program that is underway is the Grasshopper Infant Forest Experience Center
Grasshopper Infant Forest Experience Center with Active Experience Program

Among the children's forest experience centers in Seoul, the program is being actively conducted in Geumcheon-gu's grasshopper. Most of the other places just use space without specialized programs. In addition, the name of the park or mountain was used as the name, but Geumcheon-gu made the name of the infant forest using ‘Bestang’, a pronoun of insects that play with fun. Groups can be booked in kindergartens or daycare centers on weekdays, and on Saturday mornings, individual families can participate in the program. Of course, if you find it on a weekday, you can play at the forest experience place without reservation. Although the contents of the program vary depending on the season, it is common to observe trees, insects, and grass at the Gamrocheon Ecological Park attached to the side, and return to the experience center to finish with various games.

Children listening to their heads
Various experiences are prepared according to the characteristics of the season. In the fall, pine cones and pine cones that fall on the forest road are picked up for viewing, and red ripe cornel berries and hawthorn berries are also tasted. It is easy for children to understand that the plant spreads seeds in a variety of ways, such as feeding on birds and animals with delicious fruits or flying like a leaf and flying in the wind.
Edible hawthorn, hawthorn fruit
Acorns and chestnuts feed small animals such as squirrels and blue-eyed squirrels, but children seem to cry suddenly when they are told that adults can scarcely feed them. At that time, a young snow cap appears and rides the tree. The children are fascinated and look at them as they move around the branches quickly.
I met a new friend
When rubbing, the county leaves with a sweet odor are collected and rubbed, and the children slowly become friends with the forest as they directly tickle whether the germ tree is really tickling.
Shall we burn it all together?
After going around the Gamrocheon and returning to the experience hall, you make a spinning top with an acorn, and play darts with a tokari that sticks well to your clothes. The game of moving the pine cone with two sticks is simple and fun.
Even a single pine cone is fun
Playground in the forest is endless, such as playing house with grass and leaves, jumping over tree stumps, jumping on a rope lined between trees, or swinging.
Play as a treasure from the forest
If you aren't hungry, you can play all day long. There is a place to play with water, so it is good to take extra clothes.
Playing in the water is always fun
Forest playground in the city center, Samcheong Park toddler forest experience center
Samcheong Park, which has an old and deep forest, has an infant forest experience area. It features a wider variety of experience spaces than other places. At the entrance to the park, there is a ‘forest of concentric’, and if you go up a little further, ‘the forest of water’ comes out in summer, and ‘forest in the forest’ is on top of it.
Samcheong Park Infant Forest Experience Board
Concentric Forest is a playground made of eco-friendly materials such as wood and has swings and slides. The water forest was created along a small valley in the park, but now the water is almost dry.
Have the leaves gimbap
Interesting is the forest in the woods. Various facilities created using forest terrain and original trees, such as adventure playgrounds, playing houses, and wooden xylophones, are spread all over the forest. A bag hanger made with wooden pillars on the side, a leaf-shaped flat, and a playhouse made by cutting large wooden barrels as they are. Insect models such as dragonflies, stink bugs, and scarab beetles are naturally attached to trees.
The forest smells good
Wooden xylophones made of wood cut to length, insect apartments filled with branches or stones, and large blocks of wood are all perfect for curious children.
The swinging legs are thrilling

The forest speed library at the entrance of the park is also a specialty. Through the window, you can feel the freshness of the forest as it is and decorate it with floor-type bookshelves so that children can easily read books. When you come out of the park, you can see Samcheong-dong alley with beautiful cafes and stores.

The forest speed library is also famous for its relaxing atmosphere.
Infant Forest Experience Center # 1, Cheongnyongsan Infant Forest Experience Center

The Cheongryong Mountain Youth Forest Experience Center, which nestled at the foot of Cheongryong Mountain in Gwanak-gu, is the first infant forest experience center in Seoul. 500 meters from Gwanak-gu Office, it is not difficult to reach by public transportation. Walk past the Gumin Hall and walk along the fence of Cheongnyong Elementary School to the left to reach the entrance to the experience hall. If you go up the forest road, it is an experience field.

Build an Indian house
It is composed of a variety of spaces depending on the type of play, such as a shelter with tents, a clan that can play with water, a sand playground, a parish playground with lots of wood and wooden poles, and an adventure playground. There are many active activities, such as making wooden dominoes or building pillars in the form of cones to build an Indian house, or grabbing a string tied to a slope.
Line up
Climbing on a wooden pole can be frightening, but when you do it, you get a trick. Even a frightened child gradually tastes a proud sense of accomplishment in what he does. The forest is deep and the trees are thick, so the air is refreshing and birds are heard.
I met a young man
It is better to visit and play with the toddler forest experience center as often as possible, rather than experiencing it once or twice.
Do n’t pick up acorns for the animals in the forest.
Travel information

Grasshopper Infant Forest Experience Center
Address: 102-82, Doksan-ro 54-gil, Geumcheon-gu, Seoul
Inquiries: 02-2627-1657 (Geumcheon-gu Office Park Greening Division)

http://reserve.geumcheon.go.kr/

Cheongnyongsan Infant Forest Experience Center

http://www.mandoo.so/

Rooms

item.title: Alleyway taste trip to another world, Yeonnam-dong alley food and coffee shop - Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Taco and Quesadilla of Bemucho Cantina, Mexican family meal

Alleyway taste trip to another world, Yeonnam-dong alley food and coffee shop

Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea

When you cross a crossing in Hongdae Street, crowded with crowds all day, you meet Yeonnam-dong, which leads to an old and alley. Narrow alleys, Yeonnam-dong Alleys, filled with analogue sensibility and vintage charm, are filled with strange and fresh taste and aroma.
Except for more than 50 m, an exotic day at the Thai restaurant 'Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai', 'Coffee Shop Issim', 'Coffee Breve', Mexican restaurant 'Bemucho Cantina', and curry restaurant 'Himeji' Is simple, comfortable, fragrant and plain.
Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai Appetizer, Fried Shrimp Pork
Nice place to walk slowly alone, Yeonnam-dong alleyway
There are such people. An alley that only I know, a gourmet that only goes to me. The small desire to keep everyone's own space without wanting to inform anyone seems to be selfish and timid, but the inner heart of saving that space is more affectionate and passionate than anyone else. This is the heart of people who love the alleys of Yeonnam-dong.
After walking off the bustling street at the intersection of Exit 3 of Hongik University Subway Station and walking for about 10 minutes on the left side of the street, you will see a small alley going down the side of the Kimbab House. This is a small alley leading to Yeonhui-dong, the old address of Yeonnam-dong, located at 227. Gallery, bookstore, coffee shop, and restaurant representing Yeonnam-dong are gathered in the alleyway overlooking the neighborhood at a glance.
Gallery Barracks opened in the alley of Dongjin Market

Influencing the wind of culture and art in the alleys of Yeonnam-dong, known as Chinatown and Knights Restaurant, is a complex cultural space called 'Place Mak'

www.placemak.com

to be. It opened in 2010 and re-lighted the old alleys of the old town by collecting and displaying chairs containing the memories of residents of Yeonnam-dong. More than 30㎡, this is a non-profit space that begins as an artistic shelter for residents of Yeonnam-dong, where free and innovative exhibitions of young artists such as installation, sculpture, furniture, and paintings can be freely continued. As a small tree in front of the gallery, the gallery is like a love room in the neighborhood where anyone can look back and relax.

Gallery, Place of Culture and Art in Yeonnam-dong Alley
As you walk through the alleys of Yeonnam-dong, you'll find a bookstore that has disappeared into a faint memory due to the cafes and pubs. It is the bookstore Pinocchio (070-4025-9186), which sells picture books as the first graphic novelty store in Korea that opened a year ago.
Picture book, bookstore Pinocchio that adult and child see together
In a 20㎡ space, looking through essays, illustration books, and handmade fairy tales full of beautiful paintings, you will be moist. There are also valuable books imported from overseas in the bookshelf, where the picture books seen by adults and children are packed together.
A space full of essays and fairy tales with pretty pictures
Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai

If you've entered the alley in search of a hot place in Yeonnam-dong, you may be disappointed at the plain atmosphere of the entrance to the alley and the simple entrance down to “Tuk-tuk Noodle Thai”. A small alley that runs smoothly is beautiful after long viewing. Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai's food is also a taste that falls out once you taste it.

Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai's representative menu, Yang Yang and Yang Tam Kai
Chefs from Issan, northeast of Thailand, say the food is exceptional. That's why Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai's food is delicious. The Thai food produced by local chefs from Issan is generous and local style compared to other places, making it especially satisfying for local food lovers. When you enter the dining room, the hammock ceiling, elephant painted walls, and exotic wooden tables create an exotic atmosphere with a unique herbal scent.
Stir-fried noodles with plenty of pork and vegetables, Pad Thai
Chicken and papaya salad with curry powder and spices added to the dish, and Yom Tam Khai Yang is a signature menu of Tuktuk Noodle Thai. The crispy fried chicken and sweet and sour sweaty salad are fresh enough to fit any dish.
Crispy fried chicken and papaya salad
똠 Yang-Yang, a dish with rich broth, is a taste that combines the sour taste of tomato, lime, and lemongrass, the sweet taste of coconut milk, and the juicy texture of crayfish.
Iced tea enjoyed by Thais
In addition, you can taste over 50 different Thai dishes, such as Pad Thai, Punim Pat Pong Curry, and Chek Man Yum.
Entrance to Tuk Tuk Noodle Thai
It is also famous as a regular home for foreigners living in Korea, so reservation is required. In some cases, your reservation may be over a week ago.
Interior decorated with local Thai ornaments
Bemucho Cantina's Mexican Homestyle

Most restaurants in Yeonnam-dong are open until noon. It is a small store run by one or two people, so there are many things to prepare. “Bemucho Cantina”, with five tables, is decorated with ornaments from Mexico, the owner's hometown, and is like a pub in Mexico.

The Bemucho Cantina, shortened to the “Besame Mucho Tavern,” is a place where Mexican men and women from Yeonnam-dong meet and cook Mexican home-cooked meals. The owner, who has a strong sense of cooking experience in Mexico, offers fresh and hearty Mexican cuisine by picking local ingredients. It is basic to use fresh lettuce and tomatoes. By making use of the taste of the hometown, they produce exotic and delicious Mexican food.
Bemucho Cantina Spinach Quesadilla and Fried Chicken Tacos
Popular menu items include chicken bria, lettuce, corn, onion, paprika, sour cream, and tomato salsa sauce. Fry Chicken Taco, which is perfect for Koreans, tastes delicious with tomato salsa salad by frying the taco with chicken.
Fry Chicken Taco, the main menu of Bemucho Cantina
The husband takes care of the dishes, and the wife devotes himself to traditional Mexican drinks. Orchata, a traditional rice drink that is seasoned with sugar and cinnamon by grinding rice flour every three or four times, is often sweet and savory. There are many customers on the weekend and there are few tables, so if you make a reservation 30 minutes in advance, the table will be empty.
Cooking is more delicious with traditional Mexican beverages
Slow food, Himeji curry rice

During lunchtime, a long line of curry pours along the smell of the sweet curry. The representative menu of Himeji is curry rice. The old bicycle shop reminds me of a small home in a Japanese residential area. It is a cozy and comfortable atmosphere where the curry rice is good for indoors.

Curry rice, cooked in a Japanese style with only vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and broccoli, is familiar to us. The popular curry udon, which is eaten with curry, is also popular. The soy sauce noodles with plenty of ginger aren't Japanese soba, but the noodles that the owner used to boil with Haejang. The soft noodle goes well with the taste of the soup that opens up inside.
Himeji reminds me of a small Japanese family home
Curry rice is topped with curry sauce that is boiled and boiled in yellow and wrinkly cooked rice with turmeric. The pieces of bell peppers sprinkled like a decoration are chewed crisp and give a pleasant taste. The scent of pepper goes very well, so I eat a lot of rice by scratching it. I have never learned cooking, no restaurant experience, and no secrets, but like the taste of a mother's hand, Himeji's curry boiled for a long time without feeling spared the essence of slow food.
Coffee full of heart, coffee shop Lee Sim and coffee libre

An alley that is familiar to those visiting Yeonnam-dong is a road park path from Himeji to Bookstore Pinocchio, the back street of Dongjin Market and the next big road and Yeonnam-dong Community Service Center. There is a coffee shop that hopes to stay in Yeonnam-dong for a long time, even if a new cultural space enters the Dongjin Market, where only traces remain, and there are three or four cafes a month.

Yeonnam-dong has a coffee shop where you can drink the best coffee
There are two coffee shops in Yeonnam-dong that attract coffee enthusiasts: 'Coffee Store Lee Sim' and 'Coffee Brivre'. 'Issim', famous for its Turkish coffee, grinds coffee in a traditional way with a tool called 'Ibrick'.
Coffee shop Lee Sim is crowded with coffee lovers
For the regulars who come to buy long beans, the coffee beans piled up by Subuk and a thick roasting machine make you feel proud of good coffee.
Papua New Guinea Kimmel from drip
Coffee Libre's coffee menu that made Yeonnam-dong trouble while on the air with 'Good Coffee' is more straightforward than I thought.
Drip coffee with owner's sincerity is more fragrant
Four types of brewed coffee, espresso, americano, aeropress or french press.
Coffee Libre exterior showing the virtues of simplicity
If you buy coffee beans, a cup of coffee is free. Roasting green beans and brewing coffee all day is busy.
The medicine cabinet Kankan is full of fresh beans.
We bring in and sell the best green beans selected from the “Cup of Excellence”, which ranks the best among the beans harvested each year.
Complimentary takeaway coffee with purchase of coffee beans

item.title: Kalguksu and Naengmyeon are services? A service restaurant in Seoul that is more generous than the main dish - Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
If you order glutinous rice, you can taste cold noodles and kalguksu

Kalguksu and Naengmyeon are services? A service restaurant in Seoul that is more generous than the main dish

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It is spring. There is a restaurant that I want to visit, hoping that the frozen pockets will melt like spring snow. These are good restaurants that serve the service with a brighter supporting menu than the main dish, the main character.
The spicy cuttlefish stir-fry and potato soup are served as a service in the fragrant oyster bossam of Jongno 3-ga Bossam Alley that soothe the longing of Pimatgol. If you order a bowl of glutinous rice from Namdaemun Market's Kalguksu alley, you will be served with a set of hot Kalguksu and refreshing cold noodles, and a happy scream comes out.
The three sisters of Namhae Restaurant, which has the most regulars
Wrap up the remaining rice. Would you like some more kalguksu?

Namdaemun Market is the largest traditional market in Seoul, so there are many entrances. Among them, Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station on Subway Line 4 is the starting point to meet famous restaurants in Namdaemun Market. From the entrance to Namdaemun Market, restaurants that boast 50 years of history are hidden in alleys that are entangled like a spider's web along the main road. In addition to the 50-year-old joy of ruining the 70-year-old tail gomtang restaurant, Gangwon House, which has been loved as a chicken gomtang since 1962, and Namdaemun Market's Galchijorim alley, there are rows of royal feet, hand-wheat dumplings, and vegetable hotteok. There is a myriad of food and jujeon beak.

In front of Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station, there is a kalguksu alley full of people who want to taste good kalguksu all year round. When you open a shabby plastic door and enter, more than 10 small kalguksu gather on both sides to seduce guests with the smell of anchovy soup. Kalguksu, which boils fiercely in dozens of pots with steaming steam, has the power to soften the tension that has been stuck in the daily life. It is a moment to meet the good price of a bowl of rice or kalguksu and the virtue of an infinite refill service.
Kalguksu alley restaurants without seats
It is frowned upon by the enthusiasm of the enthusiasm from the entrance, saying that if you order the rice, you can taste Kalguksu on cold noodles. Namhae Restaurant of three sisters who do not lose their smile even in the alley of Kalguksu, which forms a buksaetong, has secured the longest table after 25 years. Half of the happy customers are regulars over a decade old. Ten people and 20 people are sitting on the chair. In a good-hearted store, will the customers' feelings be too full? If you sit down in a narrow enough place to hit the shoulders and order a bowl of rice, there is no chance to complain because the side dishes and miso soup come out with kalguksu and cold noodles.
Instantly cut and boiled Kalguksu
Kalguksu noodles, which are kneaded by dozens of times as a restaurant specializing in Kalguksu, are cut into thin pieces by hand, and the shape is also jagged and thin, but even if it's arbitrary, it tastes chewy. The rich anchovy broth is served with plenty of savory spicy sauce and served with a spicy and refreshing seasoning. The feeling of satiety comes in a few times. It is impossible to have a leisurely meal because of people standing in a narrow alley with a folding screen. However, if you are ready for a tough table setting in a crowded market place, you can taste rice, kalguksu and cold noodles in one room. It also packs the leftover rice with a large amount. It costs 6,000 won for rice, 5,000 won for kalguksu, cold noodles and barley. Business hours from 6 am to 9 pm, closed on holidays
The cold noodles served as a taster are hearty appetizers
A special service in Jokbaljip, lined up with rice cake
The crossroads in front of City Hall are busy throughout the day with the steps of office workers. When the sun begins to flap, a long line begins to form in the narrow alleyway of City Hall Station Exit 8. It is a procession of guests who want to enter the “satisfaction” that netizens and gourmets have chosen as the three major jokbals in Seoul.
Ohyangjokbal in organic
After 6 pm, the sound of a number tag from the waiting machine at the door of the restaurant is bustling. For those looking for food, the long line is a warm-up space where the food is full of excitement. It is time to shake off the subjective taste and prejudice of others and prepare an empty stomach appropriately. You should also be prepared to wait more than 30 minutes between 6 and 8 pm.
Instant Chinese-style rice cake soup
'Satisfaction' created a menu called 'Ohyangjokbal' when the owner's hand tasted Jokbal when he ran a Chinese restaurant in the past. Ten or so ingredients such as octagon, sancho, cinnamon, and ohyang were added to the jokbal to catch the smell of meat and bring out the unique taste of the ohhyang jokbal. If you make a jokbal, the pot of Mangukguk first takes its place. It is a visual that the egg soup served with fried rice overlaps.
Jokbal eats with savory garlic sauce.
In the hot pot, chewy rice cake soup and Chinese water dumplings are floating in the east. The dumplings that go into Mangukguk are not made directly, but they are made to order, so the taste is neat and soft. Before Jokbal comes out, Manguk-guk is very refreshing and refreshing. It's a bit awkward to call it a service menu with jokbal.
A generous statue was prepared with jokbal and rice cake soup.
When a delicious jokbal comes out in a heavy banquet, the real value of Manguk-guk begins to show up. There is no shrimp sauce, ssam vegetables, and kimchi on the table of 'satisfaction'. Instead, vegetables, radish vegetables, and garlic sauce come out. Garlic sauce with a sweet and sour taste is a special sauce that is moistened with cabbage and put on a jokbal. Since it is a mildly strong jokbal, it goes well with the spicy garlic sauce, but it is more likely to taste when eaten with boiled manguk soup. The feeling of jokbal, a clump of collagen, goes down neatly in a hot and cool broth. Soft dumplings and chewy rice cake soup are enough for one meal. The jokbal has a feeling that tteokman-guk soup is hotter than spicy makguksu.
There are many office workers on weekdays and couples on weekends.
At 7 o'clock on the weekends, jokbals often fall and wait an hour, so it is good to check on the phone. On weekdays from 11:30 to 2 am, only meal menus are available, and jokbals are sold from the afternoon. Jokbal (medium) KRW 29,000. Jokbal is served on weekdays from 3pm to 10pm (weekends start at 2pm). Closed on holidays
A long line runs through a narrow alley at 6:00 p.m.
The reason why fried squid is better than oyster bossam
The back alley, called Pimatgol, between Insadong and Jongno is where people's love comes from. The name pimatgol comes from pimadong (避 馬 洞), which avoids horses. It was formed on a narrow road that only one person could pass, avoiding the large road, where frequented by the old man. Winding from the alley of Jonggak Station to the alleys of Insadong and Jongro Precious Metals.
Bossam served with Tongyeong oyster
According to the urban plan, the old alleys and old buildings are destroyed, and in the modern building, there are 76-year-old Chongjin-dong Haejang-guk, a 60-year-old mung bean bean cake, and Cheongil-jip, famous for cold buckwheat noodles. The pimatgol near Jonggak disappeared into a high-rise building, and the back alley of the precious metal mall in Jongno 3-ga, which still has traces of it, continues the pimagol.
The broth with 10 or more herbal ingredients is neat
Exit 15 of Jongno 3-ga Station and you will see a narrow alleyway between the pharmacy and the precious metal mall. Just go into the alley that is easy to graze, and if you look around, you can see more than 10 signs of Bossamjip between the alley and alley. This is a Bossam alley where you can taste fresh oysters and hearty meat. In front of the door, three large pots with lids open for boiling meat are placed. Samhaejip, Jeonjujib, and Janggun Bossam in this alley serve potato soup with Bossam as a service. Among them, Janggun Bossam has one more service menu. Squid stir-fried with briquette fire, which has an attractive scent. This is a special service menu unique to this house, created by the taste of the owner who was a chef.
Fried squid is more popular than Bossam
Potato soup pot rises over the fire while Bossam is being prepared. When the boiled potato soup starts to boil, Bossam comes out with a oyster that is aired every day in Tongyeong. When you eat bossam kimchi, which you soak every day, with boiled meat, you can see Janggun Bossam's hidden card, Squid stir-fry. It is a service menu that is loved so much that there are customers who come against the spicy and crispy fried squid than Bossam. If you're a savory meaty pork with delicious Bossam Kimchi, rich soup of potato soup, and crispy fried squid, it's great to eat with rice, and it's also a great snack for alcohol.
Potato soup made by boiling perilla powder is also popular as a snack
During the week, mainly office workers come for a drink, and on weekends, families from all over the country gather to taste bossam and squid stir-fries. On one weekend evening, guests waited in line for three hours. As it is a peeling sheet with both taste and heart, it is possible to have a service menu with a larger belly than the belly. Gulbossam (small) 23,000 won, Squid stir fried 5,000 won. Business hours from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 a.m. the next day, all year round
Golbossam and stir-fried squid, hearty table topped with potato soup
Travel information

1.Access

Namhae Restaurant: Go out of Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station on Line 4 and located in Kalguksu Alley opposite the street on the right
Satisfaction : Go straight at Exit 8 of City Hall Station on Line 2, and go straight 50m into Olive Young Alley
General Bossam: Exit No. 15 of Jongno 3-ga Station on Line 1 and located in the Bossam Alley inside the alley of Pharmacy and Jongno Precious Metal Shopping Center

2. Restaurants around

Namhae Restaurant: 21 Namdaemun Market 4-gil, Jung-gu / 02-319-7245

Satisfaction : 134-6 Seosomun-ro, Jung-gu / 02-753-4755

General Bossam: 22 Supyo-ro 20-gil, Jongno-gu / 02-2274-9548

3.Accommodation

Hyoseondang: 49-14, Yulgok-ro, Jongno-gu / 02-725-7979

http://www.hyosundang.com/

Just Stay: 3, Euljiro 40-gil, Jung-gu / 02-2271-2287

Hotel Sejong: 3-8, Supyo-ro, Jung-gu / 02-2267-2655

http://www.sejonginn.co.kr/index.php

item.title: Introducing the Three Musketeers of Namdaemun Market! Kalguksu, Sashimi, Tail Gomtang - Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
It's soft and crisp, not enough with one bowl of rice

Introducing the Three Musketeers of Namdaemun Market! Kalguksu, Sashimi, Tail Gomtang

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It's fun to see the market even if there is no specific use. Fun to choose a variety of things, to taste a variety of food, and to see people. There is no end to the market views that have a lot of fun. Today, we are going to focus on ‘flavor’, which belongs to the ‘big fun’ of overflowing fun. As it is a representative market in Seoul, a variety of foods overflow. Introducing the more interesting Namdaemun & Dongdaemun taste tour than the market. Let's take a look at Namdaemun Market.

Before going on a full-fledged market taste tour, let's take a moment to look at the history of the market. Namdaemun and Dongdaemun markets, where at first glance the buried years are buried, when did they start? To know the history of the market, you must go back to the Joseon Dynasty. The market for buying and selling goods began to grow rapidly in the late Joseon period, when the exchange of goods from the barter to the full-fledged monetary economy began.

The more interesting the history of Namdaemun Market

Along with the history of the market, modern and contemporary history of the land comes together. In the market where people, money, and products are gathered, the situation at that time remains as clear as “Nite”. The capital, Hanyang, was the center of the market as well as the administration. The luxury goods and daily necessities needed by the palaces and the yangban corps flow to the present Dongdaemun, Lee Hyun (actor) and Chil plaque market outside Namdaemun.
The modern permanent market started in Seoul in the late 19th century, more than 100 years ago. At that time, the Ministry of Hanseong promoted a project to widen the road width by removing commercial temporary buildings lined up in Jongno and Namdaemun-ro. This temporary building was called a 'gaga (temporary building)'. The 'shop' comes from here. When the demolition of the small merchants' livelihoods are overwhelmed, the government gives them the warehouses of Namdaemun and Sunhyecheong. This is Namdaemun Market. But it didn't last long.
In 1905, the Japanese imperialists took the diplomatic right of the Korean Empire with the “Korea-Japan Negotiation Treaty”. With this treaty, Korea becomes a Japanese colony. At that time, the Japanese who lived on the yolks of Chungmuro and Myeongdong must have caught sight of Namdaemun Market. When rumors circulated that the Ministry of Justice would take the Namdaemun market and hand it over to the Japanese, Korean traders who were struggling to find an alternative to create a new market on top of it covering the section from Gwangcheon (now Cheonggyecheon) Gwanggyo to the officers. From Gwanggyo to officers, it was named “Gwangjang Market” after the preceding letter. This is the story of Gwangjang Market, which we are looking for to eat 'Nokdubindaetteok' and 'Drug Kimbab'.

Tour of Namdaemun Market starting at Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station
Chilpe Market outside Namdaemun in the late Joseon Dynasty was famous for the Nanjeon. Although it is slightly different from the current position of Namdaemun Market, it is usually regarded as the beginning of Namdaemun Market. Namdaemun Market in the 21st century is also close to Myeong-dong, making it a popular tourist course.
When you come out of Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station, the stalls on the side of the street greet us. From the udon and noodles, there are plenty of food stalls to enjoy, such as fried giblets and bear eel. What to eat starts with the most exciting worries in the world. The huge Namdaemun market travel guide is not overlooked. This time, let's focus on ‘Taste’ to suit the purpose of ‘Marketing Tour’. The main street starts from Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station. Around this large street is the Kalguksu Alley, which is considered as a delicacy of Namdaemun Market, and the Galchijorim Alley. In addition to this, the gomtang restaurant <Eunho Restaurant>, which has been in business for over 30 years, and <chicken delicacy (formerly Gangwonjip)>, which has a delicious taste of torn chicken, are added.
When you come out of exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station
From cheap and hearty Kalguksu alleys to cooked tail soup
The starting point of the tour is Kalguksu Alley. The name is ‘Kalguksu Alley’, but when you order the type of rice (barley rice, rice), it comes with kalguksu and cold noodles. Even if you order Kalguksu, cold noodles are served. The cold noodles are served in a small bowl, but the noodles are quite generous. Two women can fill their stomachs with just one order of barley rice.
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Alley View
It adds to the atmosphere of the market alley, so it's okay for a different emotional trip. Barley rice, cold noodles 5,500 won, kalguksu, sujebi, feast noodles 5000 won. However, what if you put your hands on your chest and you're pretty neat? Pass!
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Alley
If you want to taste Kalguksu at a restaurant instead of a chair in a market alley, there is <Hansunjason Kalguksu>. Exit from Kalguksu alley and follow main road. Even if you order any menu, cold noodles are a service. Walk out to the main street again. Turn left at the intersection of Coco Shopping Center and Chengja Imports Shopping Mall and you will see Gomtang Restaurant <Eunho Restaurant> representing Namdaemun.
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Kalguksu in the alley
Eunho Restaurant is a gomtang specialty store that has been passed down for three generations since 1932 for over 80 years, and has a history of Namdaemun Market. A bowl of Gomtang that has been carefully chopped has been loved by locals and marketers as well as local workers. You can taste tail bear soup (17,000 won), crucible soup (13,000 won), and Haejangguk (6000 won). In addition to <Eunho Restaurant>, be aware of <Jinju House>, known as the Namdaemun Market Gomtang House Yangdae Mountain Range. <Jinju House>, which boasts a relatively clear Gomtang soup, is located in an alley with brown rice.
Namdaemun Market's successor to the three generations <Eunho Restaurant>
Still, the menu that is indispensable in Namdaemun Market is braised!
Get out of <Eunho Restaurant> and go straight up to Main Street again. Anpan, Wangmandu, and fried fish cakes are eye-catching.
Deep-fried fish cake with popularity
Keep walking and a jokbaljip comes out. Then, if you see <Namdo Glasses>, turn left without hesitation. It is an alleyway. The whole winding alley is a galore house. Happy worry begins where to go.
Namdaemun Market Galchirim Alley
Serves one person without notice. If you order a braised stew (8000 won), you can even boil eggs (5000 won) and fried galchi (8000 won). When people who visit the first alley stewed sometimes order a stew or a tempura, the friendly owner adds, "Just stewed and give a fried egg and steamed egg."
If you order stewed brown rice, steamed egg and fried deep-fried chicken are a service.
Two bowls of rice are ready to serve in a sturdy yet crisp brown pot. If you decide to go on a diet, go after a success. A piece of brownfish steals the taste. Where is that? The chicken remodeling shop <chicken delicacy (formerly Gangwonjip)>, where you can choose the skin and flesh of your choice, is also a touch to protect the alley.
The pots filling the alley

Let's go on a trip to Namdaemun Market, a place full of food that tourists as well as tourists can enjoy without hesitation, and a trip to the beginning of winter.

▶ How to get to Namdaemun Market: Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station on Subway Line 4
The pots filling the alley
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

item.title: It seems like Seoul, like a foreigner, as if it is the present, as if it is the past - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Seoul scenery from the roof of Umdan-gil 'Um Record'

It seems like Seoul, like a foreigner, as if it is the present, as if it is the past

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

From the bustling street of Itaewon, you can take a brief walk through the Itaewon 119 Safety Center to the hidden spot in Itaewon, the way to Usadan-gil. The road is divided in front of Bogwang Elementary School, but as you go up the 10th road to the left Usadan-ro, the full-scale Usadan-gil tour begins. The entrance to Usadan-gil has an exotic atmosphere, with restaurants in Pakistan, Turkey, Egypt, Lebanon, and India, signboards written in Arabic, and strangers wearing hijab and turban. The Islamic Mosque of the Republic of Korea, the first Islamic member in Korea that opened in 1976, peaks in exotic mood.
The Islamic Bridge in Seoul is the landmark of Usadan-gil.
Since there is support for Islam, there are many halal food stores around. Halal food refers to food permitted to Muslims. Because it goes through strict standards according to Islamic law, it is an atmosphere that has recently been recognized as a health food, leaving religious colors. You don't have to be familiar with halal food. There is also a restaurant specializing in Halal certification on Usadan-gil. 'Eid' and 'Macan' are typical. We serve foods familiar to us, such as grilled fish, bulgogi, and bibimbap. It is the same as regular Korean food, except that it uses halal-certified ingredients. Many Muslims who want to taste Korean food come to Korea during their travels.
Unfamiliar but unfamiliar Pakistani food
If you want to taste exotic halal food, there are many choices. You can also enjoy kebabs, Indian foods, which are quite popular in Korea, and Pakistani, Egyptian, and Turkish foods that are still a bit unfamiliar. 'Pak India Restaurant' is a Pakistani food specialty store. Although the word Pakistani food is unfamiliar, the main menu is similar to Indian foods such as Tandoori Chicken, Curry, and Nan, and it is surprisingly familiar.
“Cerban Café” selling Turkish desserts
'Cerban Café' is also recommended. When you enter the store, first of all, the interior reminiscent of Turkey catches the eye. Decorated with ornaments and tiles from Turkey. Here, you can enjoy sweet Turkish desserts, tea and panini kebab. If you don't know what to eat, order from Baklava. Baklava is a sweet pastry with nuts, and is the representative dessert of Turkey. There are various types of original, pistachio and chocolate, and it goes well with Turkish coffee or tea. Other Turkish desserts, bread, cookies and ice cream are also available.
Usadan-gil, the old and new
Another attraction of Usadan-gil is that it retains the nostalgic Korean emotion and atmosphere. This area is a residential area where old houses and alleys are closely connected, and was designated as a redevelopment area in 2003. Since rent is relatively cheap compared to the surrounding area, young artists and young entrepreneurs entered the Usadan-gil since the early 2010s, creating a space full of personality. That's how Usadan Road is now.
The first member of 'Usadan-gil', 'Champ Coffee', has a nice appearance.
Many shops and workshops entered and disappeared repeatedly, and they also suffered from upset. Still, there are shops that keep this place. Champ Coffee and Otto are typical. 'Champ Coffee', an early member of Usadan-gil, has a nice appearance. It looks like an old rice house or a hole shop. This is a space where people in the neighborhood seemed to have stopped by. Champ Coffee actually acts as a love room for Usadan-gil. The largest table is a place where the owner works, and a seat where anyone can sit. When you sit here, you are a regular or wanderer. Various stories come and go in front of a cup of coffee. I don't know how to pass the time thanks to a good host, such as the background of the birth of a champa coffee, the way to drink the champa coffee, and how to drink it.
“Oto” wasabi kimbap, a taste that both Koreans and foreigners love.
‘OTTO’ near Champ Coffee is a kimbap restaurant introduced in TV programs 〈Master of Life〉 and American daily 〈New York Times〉. Wasabi kimbap, which contains romaine and wasabi sauce, is famous for its shape and taste. It is a taste that will be enjoyed not only by Koreans but also by foreigners, so visitors from various countries visit it. The outdoor terrace is as attractive as Gimbab. On a sunny day, sit on a small terrace overlooking Usadan-gil and try eating gimbap. It gives the taste and taste that will remain with life gimbap.
'Um Record' indoors with vintage and analog atmosphere
The highlight of Usadan-gil is hidden in 'Um Record' on the side of Dokkaebi Market. A sound record that easily and conveniently touches the vinyl (LP) culture, you can enjoy music with LP and cassette tape while drinking a drink or beer. Of course, you can also purchase. Famous artists come to shoot pictorial because of the vintage and analog atmosphere. In particular, the rooftop is a masterpiece. From the Namsan Seoul Tower to the Usadan-gil Dokkaebi Market, you can see the plastic tent at a glance. In between, old houses and alleys fill each other. Seoul, which embraces Usadan-gil, is far and warm. It is a moment to fully appreciate the essence of Usadan-gil, which sits on a high place.
Itaewon Antique Furniture Street Scenery
If you want to explore more of Itaewon's characteristic paths, go to Itaewon Antique Furniture Street. It originated from the purchase and sale of furniture sold by the U.S. military as it returned to its home country, and has now established itself as a representative street for selling antique furniture in Korea. Looking at classic and antique furniture and accessories, it feels like you are walking on a street in Europe.
‘Vinyl & Plastic’ is full of analog sounds such as LP, CD and cassette tape.
Itaewon's vintage charm continues in 'VINYL & PLASTIC'. This place operated by Hyundai Card is a space full of analog sounds such as LP, CD, and cassette tape. The first floor mainly exhibits and sells LP, and the second floor exhibits and sells CDs, and turntables, cassette players, and CD players are available everywhere to enjoy music. It is a place where analog music evokes nostalgia to familiar generations and fresh stimulation to new generations familiar with digital sound sources.
Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art, designed by architecture master Mario Bota, Jean Nouvel, and Rem Colehas
An art space like a treasure is hidden in the alley opposite vinyl and plastic. This is Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art. When you arrive here, the first thing to notice is the combination of three different buildings. It's amazing that the buildings designed by architecture masters Mario Bota, Jean Nouvel, and Lem Colhas are all in one place. The collections are also huge. It exhibits ancient and modern art, including national treasures and treasures, and works by famous authors from home and abroad.
Dimuseum in Seokdangno-ro
If you want to satisfy your artistic needs, the Reading Dangro is the perfect place. The Reading Dangro has recently emerged as a hot place due to its many galleries, complex cultural spaces, cafes, and restaurants, as well as a de-museum featuring a variety of artistic contents. You can also enjoy an art and culture tour by walking along the hill road leading from Hannam-dong to Oksu-dong and Seokdangdan-ro.
<Day trip course>
Samsung Museum of Art Leeum → Binyl and Plastic → Usadan-gil → Dokseodang-ro

<2 days and 1 night trip course>
Day 1 / Samsung Museum of Art Leeum → Vinyl & Plastic → Usadan-gil → Dokseodang-ro
Day 2 / Itaewon Antique Furniture Street → National Hangeul Museum → National Museum of Korea

item.title: The Gyeongui Precinct Street where the train disappeared - Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Near the exit 6 of Hongik University Station

The Gyeongui Precinct Street where the train disappeared

Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea

There is a way to enjoy a book while walking outside the stuffy interior. It refers to 'Gyeongui Seonseo Street', which is a book-themed theme around Hongik University Station, renowned for its music, art and youth. It's a good way to sit on a bench and read a book on the upcoming spring day. This is a road where you can enter the booth installed at the Gyeongui Precinct Street and enjoy the good luck of sharing your eyes with the artist you stumbled upon while reading a book. Let's go on a picnic in the early spring as a book street ..
Books made in the city of publishing around Hongdae
The start is exit 6 of Hongik University Station. If you come out of the basement and go back, you will see a sculpture written as Gyeongui Precinct Street. Starting from here, the road leading to the lower section of the Wo Wago Expressway is a respectable street.
On the road that leads to about 250m, there are bookstores and cultural spaces that display and sell books on various topics. Various events organized by bookstores are held at Gyeongui Seonseo Street. As you walk along the road, you can easily access works representing books and book information. There is a bicycle parking space next to the operation office, so anyone can use it. Toilets are available in the office building on the day of the event. On the other day, you should use the toilet at Hongik University Station.
There is a bicycle parking space next to the operation office
Right next to the sculpture of Gyeongui Precinct Street, there is an inscription that briefly introduces this place. Above, you can see an installation that depicts a woman reading and a man playing guitar. It is a work symbolizing the surrounding area of Hongdae, Gyeongui Precinct Street and Music Street. Please note that there is an outdoor publicity bulletin board that informs you of the events and books you are planning at Gyeongui Precinct Street.
A woman reading a book at the entrance of Gyeongui Seonseo Street
Gyeongui Line refers to the railroad linking Yongsan and Sinuiju in 1906. Even during the Japanese colonial era, it was a major means of transportation between North and South Korea. The train stopped operating for many years in the midst of war and division, but after the 2000 North-South summit, the Gyeongui Line restoration project began, and in 2009, a wide area train from Seoul Station to Munsan Station was opened. At this time, the Yongsan Line section of 6.3km connecting 'Yongsan ~ Gajwa' was made underground and made the Gyeongui Line Forest Road on the ground. It was natural for publishers to make books around Hongik University.
Gyeongui Seonseo Street Bookstore where you can meet various books
Books and cultural life at 10 booths
There are 10 booths that display, sell, or hold books at Gyeongui Precinct Street. In the booth's name, all the words 'walking' are combined to make this place a place that you can enjoy while walking. In 'Space Walk', meetings with authors, book concerts, and lectures are held. Exhibitions, small gatherings, and workshop experience programs are held at 'Future Walk', 'Creative Walk', and 'Cultural Walk'. Some bookstores are run by publishers. You can read or purchase books related to the name of the booth in 'Tourism Walk', 'Art Walk', 'Children's Walk', 'Humanities Walk', 'Literature Walk', and 'Theme Walk'.
Children's walk is exhibiting 'wild animal traces'
Each bookstore exhibits a variety of things to see or conducts experience programs.
Citizen in love with reading books
Gyeongui Preliminary Street where you can meet authors and books for 312 days
In space walks, future walks, creative walks, and cultural walks, the concept of 'where you can meet the author for 312 days' is held from Tuesday to Sunday except Mondays, which are closed.
Book sculptures on the road
In addition to the booth, various exhibits on the theme of books are installed outdoors in the Gyeongui Line. After the cultural walk, a book sculpture resembling the shape of a book stuck in a bookshelf is attached to a wall on an outdoor seat. If you are looking at sculptures engraved with the titles of books such as <Considerations from Prison>, <What is History>, and <My Cultural Heritage Interpreter>, I would like to take out a book and read it. There is also a girl statue at the end climbing a ladder to take out a book.
Book sculptures resemble the shape of a book in a bookshelf
Next is 'Text Forest'. This is an area where you can enjoy a short walk by making the letters into a forest shape.
The lights are on in the dark text forest.
If you go through the forest of text and go down to the Wow Gogga Expressway, it is the famous 'Book Street Station'. When the train was on the Gyeongui Line, it was located between Sekyori Station and Sogang Station, making it a book street station. At the bottom, traces of Gyeongui Line railroad tracks and crushed stone are visible. There are a lot of people taking photos to leave memories in the vicinity of Book Street Station, which has been stylishly decorated in mint colors.
It is the best book street station to take pictures at Gyeongui Seonseo Street
Opposite Book Street Station is 'Wow School Bulletin Board'. Wow Gogachado, the question, "What book do you want to share with you today?" Stops people coming and going. The bulletin board displays a list of books and promotional posters recommended to citizens every month.
What book do you have with you today?
There are many places to visit while walking around the Gyeongui Precinct Street. After the Wow Gogado Expressway, it is a dash. This is the name given when the train crossing the railroad crossing made the sound of a “click” as the railroad crossing went down.
Observation Street of Darkness
At the entrance to Ding Ding Street, there are statues of station officials in front of the breakers and families trying to cross the railroad tracks.
A statue representing a station attendant and a family trying to cross the street
If you turn your feet again and go up to the Wago Garage Road, you will see a wide range of Gyeongui Preemptive Streets. Like a book made on a railroad track, the cultural walk booth seen from above looks like a train. The night view of Gyeongui Seoncheok Street is so beautiful that many people who go out on a date visit it.
You can enter the Gyeongui Precinct Street from the side of the road.
Travel information

Gyeongui Preemptive Street
-Address: 50-4, Wausan-ro 35-gil, Mapo-gu, Seoul
-Inquiries: 02-324-6200
-Operating hours: 11 am to 8 pm
-Closed: Every Monday
