Inquiries: 02-2152-5800
-Free admission, 2000 won (up to 2 hours, 150 won every 5 minutes thereafter)
-Closed: Every Monday, January 1, closed by the market / closed, but not closed if Monday is a public holiday

Cocktail, highball with whiskey, soda water and ginger

"After a hard day, the only thing that comforts me when I come back to an empty house is a glass of beer. So I drink alone today."

It's hard to get a good job because of employment shortages, job insecurity, and marriage and childbirth. This is why voluntary, selective non-marriage is bound to increase. item.title: Ride the Seoul subway and go on a sunrise trip into the city center - Korea, Seoul
item.description:
Majestic Sunrise Rising Through Skyscrapers

Ride the Seoul subway and go on a sunrise trip into the city center

Korea, Seoul

I thought it was best to see the sunrise rise sharply above the sharp horizon. I really believed so. Well, I met a nice sunrise where I didn't really expect. In Seoul, where I visited the subway. It was one of the nicest sunrises I've met in the last decade. Prepared for those preparing for the New Year sunrise trip. Sunrise trip to downtown Seoul, leaving by subway.
Beautiful and colorful as night view, Maebongsan Park sunrise
Maebongsan Park is a neighborhood park built around Maebongsan Mountain that spans Seongdong-gu, Yongsan-gu, and Jung-gu, Seoul. The official name is Maebongsan Mountain in the Eungbong Neighborhood Park. The sunrise point of Maebongsan Park is the octagonal ridge that stands on top of Maebongsan Mountain. Although it is an octagonal pavement on the top of the mountain, only 174m above sea level, Maebongsan Mountain has a gentle slope and well-maintained stairs and trails, making it easy for anyone to climb. From the entrance of Maebongsan Park, you can walk 15 minutes to Palgakjeong Pavilion.
Sunrise seen from Maegbongsan Park
Maebongsan Park Palgakjeong Pavilion is famous as a night view spot among photographers. So if you walked to Maebongsan Park early in the morning, you can miss the beautiful scenery of the dawn. Han River as calm as a lake
The nightscape and the dawn of sunrise
Maebongsan Park is easy to visit. When using public transportation, get off at Vertigogae Station (Seoul Subway Line 6) and head up towards Ssamji Park.
address 428-6, Oksu-dong, Seongdong-gu, Seoul question 02-2286-5656 (Seongdong-gu Office Park Greenery Division)
Han River dyed golden immediately after sunrise
A pronoun of sunrise in downtown Seoul
Mt. Acha (295.7m) is an indispensable place to talk about sunrise spots in Seoul. Mt. Acha is located in Gwangjin-gu, the eastern end of Seoul. Gyeonggi-do is bordered by Guri. in Seoul
You can enjoy the Han River and the sunrise at Mt.
Acha Sunrise Point is a sunrise square built on the mountainside. It is 1.5km from Mt. The stairs leading up to the camel ridge are a bit steep but are not very difficult. Street lamps are installed in many places, so there is less burden on the dark dawn. Climb the Camel Ridge to see Goguryeo-jeong and climb the short rock section to get to the Sunrise Square. There are two observation decks around the rock. Tip one here. From the direction of progress, the observation deck on the left can see the dawn of the city, and the observation deck on the right can see the sunrise in harmony with the Han River. So if you want to see both of them at the same time? The first answer is right behind Sunrise Square. Climb up to a hill-shaped tower, and you can see the Han River, Gangnam area, and Bukhansan mountain in the front. There are only 30m of altitude difference between the 4th and 1st base of Acha Mountain, so if you find Mt. There is a sunrise observatory with a good view to the right and Daeseongam from the crossroad where the rocky section begins at the sunrise square.
Dawn view of downtown from the observation deck on the left side of Acha Mountain Sunrise Plaza
Mt. Acha begins hiking in Mt.Acha Ecological Park, 1.3 km from Achasan Station on Seoul Subway Line 5. There is a parking lot in front of the eco-park, so there is no burden for self-drivers. Parking is free until 8 am. After 8 am, you have to pay 150 won for 5 minutes.
address 3-19, Guui-dong, Gwangjin-gu, Seoul question 02-450-1655 (Acha Mountain Management Office)
Goguryeojeong on the camel ridge
Hot pillar of fire to wake the city, Sky Park sunrise
If Mt. Acha is the eastern end of Seoul, Sangam-dong Sky Park is the western edge of Seoul. It is located in the west of Seoul's sunrise spots, and the sunrise seen from Sky Park is different from Maebongsan Park or Mt. That is, if the two places mentioned above focus on sunrise rather than downtown,
Sunrise seen from Sky Park East photo zone
Sky Park Sunrise Point is the east photo zone. But the heavenly stairs come first. At the end of the zigzag sky staircase, you can see the dawn of the Sangam-dong World Cup Stadium and Seongsan Bridge across the Han River. From the sky stairs to the photo zone east of the sky park
Beautiful dawn scenery with Seongsan Bridge and Han River
Sky Park is 800m away from the World Cup Stadium Station on Seoul Subway Line 6, and there is plenty of parking space, making it easy to access either by public transportation or self-driving. Sky Park parking lot will be open free until 9 am, and after 9 am, parking fee of 300 won will be charged for 10 minutes based on the passenger car. As it is an unmanned parking lot, only credit and debit cards are accepted.
address 95, Sky Park-ro, Mapo-gu, Seoul question 02-304-0085 (Visitor Information Center)
Golden Sky Sky Pampas

item.title: Enthusiasm, warmth of the country, night-winding trip - Korea, Seoul
item.description:
Passion night scene contrasted with the luxury of a high-rise apartment

Enthusiasm, warmth of the country, night-winding trip

Korea, Seoul

The journey begins with daily life. It is because you feel inspiration from the moment you see something familiar, and it is identified with the excitement you experience in an unfamiliar destination. For example, Yongsan Printing Industrial Complex, which goes by way of work, and the national office that stops on the way home. It's so common that you just listen to the extraordinary things that are hidden in them. Maybe this is the best place to forget the cold wind this winter.
Since when has your passion overflowed?
Exit the South Area Exit 1 and cross the road once in the direction of Yongsan The Prime from the crossroad. The old name of this place is Namyoung-dong Printing Corporation. At one time it was noisy with the sound of a three-wheeled motorcycle carrying printed materials, but as time passed, most print shops moved to Paju Publishing Complex, where the phenomenon of cavitation quickly progressed. Of course, there was a chance of change. The redevelopment winds in Yongsan have begun building high-rise buildings one by one around. However, due to the delay in redevelopment of the printing complex, the old buildings were left untouched.
Passionate Youth Mall run by Youth Shopkeeper
However, sometime after all this place, alleys began to form. There are also a variety of foods such as chicken, ham steak, alum, pork belly, and hops. The signboard built at the beginning of the alley reminds us of its identity. 'Come on ten. Passionate. '
Passionate Youth Mall run by Youth Shopkeeper
Eul-san's printing industry has regained its vitality since the winter of 2014, when a young shopkeeper made up of members in their mid-20s. Founders, who lacked a good business source, took the place as a pioneer, where rents could be relatively cheap but they could carry nearby high-class apartment residents on their backs and form new business.
Passionate Youth Mall run by Youth Shopkeeper
With the vision of making this place a street for youth traders, they opened several restaurants with different types of food and interior. There are five youth malls that remain to date, including 'Temple's Yakiniku', 'Temple Zukkumi', 'Cheolin 28', 'Chicken Revolution' and 'Potato House'. Upon hearing that the old alley has been filled with youth's ambitions, the number is increased to dozens of other restaurants. Office workers began to fill the streets on weekdays and family guests on weekends. The lottery that the youth expected was a good burst.
Passionate Youth Mall run by Youth Shopkeeper
The night market is also open from spring 2015. As the sun goes down, a flea market sells food trucks, accessories, and vintage clothing, while a DJing party is held. Thanks to word of mouth as a sniper night market for young people, it has become a favorite spot for foreigners in recent years.
Friendly staff posing towards the camera
Keep in mind that the night market will have a rest period from November to February, which is winter. Even if the night market is not open, the passionate young man mall is open except Sundays, which are closed.
Friendly staff posing towards the camera
"Youth Mall employees are all about passion."
In addition to being a food alley formed in a distant part of the downtown area, it also has a passion. However, the unique charm of this place can be felt only by those who have wandered in the middle of passion.
Discerning comments found throughout the youth mall
Every store attracts witty phrases such as `` Do you really want it? '', `` It's there! ''
Discerning comments found throughout the youth mall
'Temple Skewers' and 'Temple Skewers' are twice as likely to be tied because they are grilled outdoors.
The staff of 'Temple Yakiniku' are grilling hard
In particular, the friendly appearance of the staff who smiles while pretending to be passing by in front of the store is impressive. Even if you take a picture, it will pose for you. I also ask you to come out well.
Daegu, the puppy director of Charcoal House
The active attitude of the employees is in line with the fact that young shopkeepers emphasize service as the biggest virtue. All of these belong to young shopkeepers, not limited to any one shop, so they pursue common values. Therefore, there is no sense of heterogeneity even if there is not enough work place in one place, and the help of other store staff comes to help. Employees seem to consider this kind attitude and service spirit the greatest weapon of enthusiasm. One of the first-time grilled employees said with a joke, "We're all passionate," but looking back, I feel that it's not overwhelming at all.
Good personality goes well with people
Worry about blowing away a drink
There are a lot of restaurants in the alley of Passion, but the second thing that is unusual is 'Dabanggu'.
1960's concept bar 'Cafe'
It is full of props from the 60s, making you feel as if you are visiting a rural grandmother's house.
I feel like I'm time travel before I step in
Even if it is not a shop run by a young shopkeeper, it is worth visiting.
Cozy atmosphere of 'Dabang'
The most interesting thing for guests coming here is the bathroom doorway.
Props to recall childhood memories
If you go in the direction the staff tells you, you will see some nacre, but the newcomer does not think it is the entrance to the bathroom.
Props to recall childhood memories
When you open the farm, the toilet appears like a lie.
The toilet appears when I open this mother of pearl
'Dabanggu' is a perfect place to enjoy a glass of sake along with pocha snacks.
Props to recall childhood memories
It's quiet and cozy because it's located in a narrow alley where you have to turn around once more.
Props to recall childhood memories
When you make a snack to boil and eat, you can forget the anxiety of the world for a while.
Rustic drink that blows away the stress of the day
A bowl of hot noodles containing the grandmother's heart
When the afterglow is in the middle of the night, you need to try a bowl of hot noodles at Yeokchon Station `` Tashima Gukbang ''. As the mountain has been changed for two times, the appearance is somewhat shabby, but the heart and taste of the grandmother's grandmother who thinks of the guest is never shabby.
Shabby but elegant `` Tashima Country Room ''
When you first visit, the dignity of the grandmother's grandmother, who throws half-words in her words, may seem unkind. But if you look a bit, you can see that all the bruises are a warm heart for the guests. If you want to have noodles, pour out a bowl of broth and pour it quickly. You can meet a lot of local aunts who come to see your grandmother, even in the short time of eating. They come to ask for their regards, and their master grandmother and Dorando are eating flowers while eating dinner.
Warm night meal to satisfy the cold wind
The menu is simple. Anchovy noodles, bibim noodles, gimbap and water dumplings are all but the most expensive is cheap enough not to exceed 5,000 won. Usually women do not forget to ask for a small amount while ordering. Those who have not been sealed by their grandmother may not easily understand. As the business hours are from 7 pm to 4 am, a lot of taxi drivers came to the store, and the owner's grandmother explained that the sheep had grown as much as he was trying to take more care. Gimbap, which is as popular as noodles, is so big that it's hard to eat in a bite.
Gimbap with simple ingredients but no taste
Travel info

item.title: Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea - Go back to Changsin-dong Alley where Park Soo-keun and Nam June Paik lived
item.description:
Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong are the outer villages of Hanyang Castle

Go back to Changsin-dong Alley where Park Soo-keun and Nam June Paik lived

Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea

The house where Seo Min-hwa, Park Soo-geun lived, and the house where video artist Nam June Paik lived are in Changsin-dong. Seo Min-hwa walks Park Soo-keun along the alleys of Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong, Jongno-gu, outside of Dongdaemun, Hanyangdo Castle.
It is a half-day trip to the Dongmyomun Design Plaza (DDP), where you can enjoy the night view of Heunginjimun Gate and alleys.
The marketplaces and alleys of Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong resurrect as cultural streets
Changyang-dong and Sungin-dong, a town outside Dongdaemun, Hanyang Castle
Exit through Dongdaemun Station (Seoul Subway Line 1) and go up Dongdaemun Castle Park. The neatly finished Hanyang Castle is a symbol of the Joseon Dynasty in 600 years. If you continue along the castle road, you can climb to the top of Naksan Castle, and the Hanyangdoseong Dulle Road is connected to Ewha Mural Village, which attracts domestic and foreign tourists.
Hanyangdoseong Museum is located at the top of Dongdaemun Castle Park.
The Hanyangdoseong Museum is located at the top of Dongdaemun Castle Park, and you can see the Heunginjimun Gate at a glance. The Dongdaemun Shopping Town is lively, with the Heunginjimun as the center, and the outer diameter of DDP stands out as the former Dongdaemun Baseball Stadium. Heunginjimun and DDP's night view, which is popular as a date course for families and young couples, will meet at sunset, and they will set the course at Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong, the lower villages of the castle.
Heunginjimun and downtown view of Dongdaemun intersection from the view of Seongseong Park
Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong are the villages outside the city where the common people lived outside the city of Hanyang. As soon as you descend the castle and turn around, the trails are well maintained outside the castle and the Changsin-dong alleys are connected. Changsin-dong is still a cluster of 2,000 sewing factories. As you walk in the alleys, you will hear a sewing machine sound through the window frame of a small sewing factory between a steep hill and a curved alley. Recently, as a part of the city's urban regeneration project, themed alleys will be built around the sewing alleys and the sewing museum will be built.
Changsin-dong Plush Alley under Naksan
If you step down to the Changsin-dong Alley, you will find the Changsin Market Taste Alley, where the pace of finding restaurants is increasing. You can get a glimpse of the hanok between the alleys. Now exit the market alley and down the street. In front of Woori Bank, you can see the signpost of Changshin Market, exit 3 of Dongdaemun Station (Lines 1 and 4). Turn left into the small alley and you will see Seongjin Super on the corner. It is a raw garter (197-33, Changsin-dong, Jongno-gu) by video artist Nam June Paik (1932 ~ 2006).
Changsin Market's Alley with Food and Old Scenery
500m from Nam June Paik's Garter to the house
Unfortunately, Nam June Paik's house was torn down in the 1950s and operated as a restaurant until recently, but it was bought by the city of Seoul in August to create a cultural exhibition space to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Nam June Paik's death next year. Nam June Paik was born in Changpo and lived in Changsin-dong until he was 18 years old. Nam June Paik's house, which had a total area of 9,900m², was a hanok, a rich house with a cadillac, which was the only two in Korea. He finished his work in 2004 after finishing his last presentation. In an interview at the time, he said, "I want to go to Changsin-dong where I grew up." I can't look inside the house, but I'm glad that it will be a new cultural space next year.
Garter of Nam June Paik
Now, he goes back to Changsin-dong Station Alley and visits the house where Seo Min-hwa artist Park Soo-geun (1914-1965) lived. If you are with children, Changsin-dong Station Alley is a must. This alley is nothing short of Treasure Island in the eyes of the children who hold the hands of mom and dad on the weekend. Princesses who can't keep their eyes in front of large dolls and princes who hold their toy cars and howl are making memories forever.
Changsin-dong Station Alley is a must for children
Crossing the crossing in front of Dongmyomae Station Exits 2 and 3, the starting point of Dongmyo Flea Market is on the left, and the left side of Park Soo-Keun painter's house (393-16, Changsin-dong, Jongno-gu) is located. Currently there are restaurants and authorized brokerage offices and there are no milestones. However, someone wrote 'Park Su-geun's house' in small letters on the wall.
Changsin-dong House where painter Park Soo-keun lived
It's a pity, but if you illuminate Park's life, its meaning comes to me. Park Su-geun, who is considered to have the strongest Korean colors, is accompanied by a qualifier called 'Sum Minhwa'. His masterpieces, including Wells, Washer, and Roadside, were all born in Changshin-dong. He drew common people who sat in alleys and markets. The old man squatted with children and the peddlers were models. Park Soo-geun lived in Changsin-dong from 1952 to 1963 and portrayed many common people until he died of illness.
A small sign written by someone who paints Park Su-geun like hope
The alleys and marketplaces of the common people drawn by Park Soo-keun
Park Su-geun, a poor painter who loved the common people, walks to Sungnye-dong Dongmyo Flea Market. The Dongmyo Flea Market, which is held only on weekends, retains the alleys and marketplaces of old times, and has recently attracted attention as a new cultural playground. Dongmyo is located in the center of the marketplace, and it has been called Dongmyo Flea Market. The tomb is the shrine of Confucius. The market place runs like a spider's web in a small alley, centering on the tomb and the main street. On weekends, young couples holding their hands, lovers on a date, and blue-eyed foreign tourists who are interested in our culture are common. As you slowly look around the marketplace, you can see the people in the paintings. It overlaps with the faces of the alleys that the poor painters faced.
Dongmyo flea market scenery attracts people every weekend
To find the Dongmyo flea market, all you need is a light pocket and a bit of snow. For a thousand won, you can taste a cup of warm Americano, a king-headed dumpling with a little boy's face, or you can pick up your style without having to notice it. A young dad holding a child's hand and going on a holiday outing says about Dongmyo Flea Market.
Tourists visiting Dongmyo in the center of Dongmyo Flea Market
“The playground is easy to reach by public transport and enjoyable with curious children. I find mystery items at my disposal so I can buy them cheaply. It is the best holiday holiday destination. ”
Changsin-dong Alleys and Marketplaces
Don't miss the tombs in the center of the market. Dongmyo is located in a relatively spacious space, so it's enough to take a break.
Heunginjimun, DDP, Dongdaemun Shopping Town
From the Soong-dong house of Park Su-geun to the Changshin-dong house of world-renowned video artist Nam June Paik, it is only 500m away. Walking along the alleyway where two artists representing 20th century Korean art lived, and looking around Heunginjimun Gate and DDP Night View at dusk, a one-day Seoul outing is enough.
Night view of DDP, popular as a date course for lovers

item.title: Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea - The unique bookstore exhibition where culture blooms in a book
item.description:
Independent publication beef stew in pamphlet form

The unique bookstore exhibition where culture blooms in a book

Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea

With the development of internet bookstores, it is hard to find bookstores around the house, as it is necessary to go to large bookstores to serve books. However, bookstores that can smell books and taste more than that are attracting people's attention little by little. Let's meet a unique bookstore that pursues a different direction than others.
‘Bookbook’, have you heard of it? Book by Book
Sangam-dong Media City Building With forest in front of the road, there is a bar, the alley where rice cakes boil together, and the old bookstore “Bukbaibook” is run by the sister and brother. Although it is bewildering to have a bookstore, it is always captivated by the charms of the Book By Book.
When you enter the entrance, you meet
Book-bookers are usually regulars when they love books. You can feel it as a space filled with hearts for the owners' books. First of all, I applied vinyl full of analog sensibility to one book so that the book did not wear out like the textbooks wrapped in vinyl in elementary school.
I have categorized it with interesting naming names, such as ‘The author Holic Jung’.
Books on display are beautifully coated with the tails of customers or authors who leave a story or recommendation about the book. There is also a customer reading card that allows you to record the books you read, so you can't erase the feeling of space for me.
Booktails packed with customers' attention
The reason for the popularity of this place is 'book mac'. Only the person who has experienced the comfort of reading typefaces with a glass of cold beer leans on the sofa on one side can know. Not only that. The owner's seal is also generous. Present free coffee coupons to customers in various ways, including writing a booktail, selling a book, and posting it on social media. Points that can be earned in a variety of ways can be used like cash, from buying coffee to purchasing books to special lectures.
Office workers relax after work
Bookstores are often transformed into different clothes. First, there is a pop-up store on one side of the bookstore. 'SUNDAYJAM', famous for homemade jam, is now in the store with a cute phrase that 'people will buy bread to eat jam'.
Sweet SUNDAYJAM
In addition, small but well-known concerts and lectures are often held, including “writer lightning” where writers and readers meet and talk. If you're curious about the schedule, visit the host's sns. In addition to blogs, Kakao Story, Instagram, and other channels through a variety of information, such as news and schedule information.
Sweet SUNDAYJAM
Red bookstore
If you're a bookworm, you might have heard the podcast ‘Red Bookstore’. In May 2012, Lee Dong-jin, a film critic, started as the main MC, and now has overwhelming No. 1 in the book category. Not only that. Thanks to its popularity, a cafe called 'red bookstore' was opened in front of the mecca of young people, Hongdae.
A mailbox that connects with critic Lee Dong-jin
Unlike the nose, which responds to the scent of coffee when you open a large, thick door like a hardcover, your eyes respond to a large, red bookshelf. Bookstores are located in the cafe area where you can enjoy coffee and chat, or spend a quiet day reading books.
Small exhibitions are held throughout the cafe
Most of the books in the bookshelves are new books and bestsellers recommended by critic Lee Dong-jin. In addition, there is a bookshelf full of books introduced in the podcast, and red bookstore enthusiasts are tempted to buy and read every book.
Don't miss out on coffee and desserts
If you want to see the critic's recording of the red bookstore, you can visit the red bookstore. There is a recording booth on the 3rd floor for podcasts on open radio.
Podcast “Red Bookstore” with listeners
Put a story in the red mailbox labeled Dear.DJ on the 2nd and 3rd floors to win the luck read by Lee Dong-jin. The schedule can be found on the official Red Bookstore blog.
‘이동진, a book I wrote’
Only sell limited edition! Your mind
Independent Publishing. This may be unfamiliar but good for people who like writing and for those who are thirsty for new books. Independent publications are books that are held in someone's arms through the help of one person from content creation to publication and distribution. Most of them are published at their own expense and do not have many copies. Instead, the preciousness doubles because it is a hard-to-find book. There are some books that aren't released, so it's like a limited edition.
Your Mind mascot cat, Morro, sitting on a stand
Your Mind is a bookstore that distributes these independent publications. Unlike other bookstores on the first floor, it is unique because it is easily accessible to people. Even without an elevator, you have to go through hard times. Instead, you will be lucky to meet a book full of author's devotion.
Your mind feels like attic
The height of the floor is quite high, but the interior, which is designed like an attic, a bookshelf, a small stand, and a desk, is warm like my library. It's warmer because there are cats sitting on the cushions in front of the bar, picking their hairs and nodding them. Independent bookstores are as different from their uniform counterparts as their production. From handbook-sized pamphlets to thin magazines that are published occasionally, their shapes, designs, and content vary. So the fun is more diverse.
Books are placed around like a desk at home
The owner is a couple addicted to independent publications. Before becoming a bookstore owner, he is a veteran producer who publishes writing, photographs, and designs by himself, including the award-winning magazine "M". Various workshops are held to lower entry barriers for those who like to write their own books.
Visitors looking at books for a long time
If you want to know more about independent publications, you can participate in the annual Unlimited Edition. You can meet independent publishers and producers who have a sense of distance from general promotion through the 'Direct Sales Booth'.
Grooming cutie cat
Travel info

item.title: Gangbuk-gu, Seoul, Korea - Happy forest path for the whole family to walk together
item.description:
Anti-tank obstacle

Happy forest path for the whole family to walk together

Gangbuk-gu, Seoul, Korea

Uiyeong-gil in Bukhansan is a good way for the whole family to walk together. It is a mountain path, but the road is wide so you can walk with your shoulders. There are no steep or steep sections, so children walk well. In the autumn and solstice, the scent of the forest scents, and when you walk on Uyi-Ring, laughter blooms in your family's face.

1.8 km from Uyi-dong to Ui Tam Prevention Center

Wuyiling Road is 6.8km in total. Among them, about 4.5km from Bui Mountain National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center to Gyohyeon Tam Prevention Center in earnest. Get off at the entrance of Doseonsa Temple and walk about 1.8km from Ui-dong Food Village to Ui-dong Food Service Center.

'Ui-dong Food Village' signboard at Ui-dong, Ui-yeong-gil
The area around the signboard of Ui-dong Food Village is untidy. Follow the road through the signboard, and there are many restaurants on both sides of the road. It's not a good place to walk. Especially on weekends, there are many cars that people who use restaurants can ride. This section is about 1.3 km long. Also, this section is an uphill road, so some people struggle from the beginning before walking in earnest.
Uiyeong-gil through Ui-dong Food Village
However, if you take this inconvenience and walk up 1.3km, the road that the vehicle cannot enter is started. If you go up this road about 500m, you will come to Bukhansan National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center. It is about 1.5km from here to Uyi-Ryeong Trail, which is easier than the road that has been walked up until now.
Bukhansan National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center
4.5 km from Wuyi Tombs Center
Uyiyeong-gil is named after the rock “Uiam” which resembles the ear of a cow. But Wuaiam is not visible in Wuyiling Road. Wooiam is on the Wuyi ridge which leads to the main peak of Dobongsan Mountain.
Ui-Ryeong-gil is a path between the listed ridge line and Songchu Nam-nam line, connecting Jangheung-myeon, Yangju-si, Gyeonggi-do and Ui-dong, Gangbuk-gu, Seoul. It was a shortcut between Seoul and northern Gyeonggi. In the past, the wagon was a narrow road, and during the Korean War, the US Army Corps of Engineers paved the way for military operations. There is a monument to the opening of the operation road on the hillside of Uyiling.
A small sign for walking barefoot
On January 21, 1968, following the so-called January 21 incident, when North Korean armed forces invaded the Blue House, military forces and combat police were stationed in 1969 to control civilian access. Since 2009, civilians have been allowed to enter the city, but only 1,000 people per day should be restricted and reservations must be made.
People walking barefoot on the road
Departure from Uytam Prevention Center starts full-scale forest road. The road is made of Masato made from weathered granite. On the side of the road, you can see a short sign called ‘Uyi-Ring Forest that feels barefoot.’ But as I walked this road, I saw only one or two people walking barefoot. Because it is not a soft soil like ocher but rough soil, people who are not used to walking barefoot or have weak skin on their feet can wear shoes again even if they walk barefoot.
Beetle anesthetic flowers bloom on the side of the road
Light purple hummingbird flowers bloom on the wide dirt road in the forest. Yellow flowers that you may not know are visible everywhere. Green forests surround the road. Children unfamiliar with the forest trails are initially hardened by the humming bees and beetles, but adapt quickly. The slope runs up a gentle uphill and then comes back.
Wuyiling Road can walk with its shoulders
Arrived at the Hui-Ring Trough. It is 1.5km from Wuyi Tam Prevention Center. The hillside remains an anti-tank obstacle, a military facility that drops a lump of concrete on the pedestal to the road to prevent enemy tanks from entering. From this place, it is going downhill to the Gyohyeon RDA. As you pass the antitank obstacles, you will see an observation deck overlooking Obong. One of the most beautiful landscapes you can see from Ouiyeong-gil is Obong.
Family steps walking lightly
Obon refers to five rocky peaks. Five bachelors who lived in a village competed to throw the rock of the listed ridge (the ridge facing Obong) into Obong to marry his beautiful daughter.
Milestones of Uyi-Ring Trough
The children also admired the landscape, “Wow look over there!” Points to the five rock peaks. From Obon Observation Deck, crouch down with water and walk down the road again.
Observation deck overlooking Obon
Children look more energetic than when they come up. Running through a wide dirt road, you can see the valley water flowing along the side of the road and look up to the blue sky. The children, who are in love with computers and smartphones, make a blue smile that resembles a forest in the fresh nature. The faces of parents who see such children are also bright.
Obon, where five rock peaks are spectacular
I walked to the Gyohyeon RDA. Ui-yeong-gil, the whole family walked together, laughter bloomed on the forest road.
Valley water flowing sideways

To walk on the road

( www.knps.or.kr )

You must make a reservation. Reservations by phone are only available for people over 65 years old and disabled and foreigners 1,000 people will be booked per day (500 people from Ui-dong and 500 people from Yangju). Wuyiling Road is open from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm and must descend by 4 pm. All passengers and companions must bring identification when using Uyi-Ryeong-gil.

Wuyiling Road through Green Forest Road
Sansa, Seokguram, hiding in Uiyeong-gil
If you go down about 1km toward the Gyohyeon Rural Guard Center from Uiyeong Trail, you will see a large vacant lot. From there, the path to the cave begins.
Road to Gyohyeon Detection Center
It is about 700 ~ 800m from the large glade to the cave. After looking around Seokguram Rock, come back and go down to Gyohyeon Rural Prevention Center.
Seokguram Rock Order
Seokgulam was founded as a costume ambassador of the Silla period, and it is said that Seolam Gwanik ambassador was heavy during the Joseon Sejong period. Although it was bombed during the Korean War, it faced a mortality crisis, but from 1954, it has been developing new features of Seokguram Grotto, including expanding the cave and building the Daeungjeon.
Grottoes
The temple is small and catches a glance. One of the most fascinating is Nahanjeon, which was built in a natural rock cave. Next to Nahanjeon, there is a staircase going up the Samsung angle. Stand up in front of Samsung Pavilion and look at the scenery in the distance. It is pleasant to see the scenery that does not obscure the view.
Three story stone tower in front of Seokguram Samsung
Travel info

Wuyi Ryong Street Wuyi Tam Prevention Center

http://www.knps.or.kr/portal/main.do

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - “Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience
item.description:
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Salad

“Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It is natural that modern people who have a great interest in health are worried about food. I know that 'what you eat' determines your body, but it's not as easy as you think to eat 'healthy food'. So prepared. Enjoy a Healing Vegetarian Trip in Seoul! Hongdae & Sinchon, a street where young people live in diverse cultures, Jongno & Insa-dong where temple restaurants are gathered, and Detox juice and salad specialty shops. Start with a vegetarian restaurant that is healthy and delicious!
Confess before starting the article. The reporter is an omnivorous man who is close to carnivorous, sharing a strong friendship with his flesh. Those who have been accustomed to the taste of chewing without caring about vegetarianism or sharing vegetarianism. This does not mean unusually looking for meat. Ordinarily, to put it plainly, I have eaten as soon as it is unbalanced. Paradoxically, this part is easier to understand by flipping the vegetarian tale of “There is no restaurant to eat.” That's because there aren't many restaurants in the land where vegetarians can eat comfortably.
Vegetarian, what is it?
Let's get to know here. For those who are indifferent to vegetarianism, 'vegetarians' are just people who eat grass without eating meat, but the type of 'vegetarian' is more subtle than you think. First, depending on whether you eat fish and seafood ‘Vegetarian’ 과 ‘Semi Vegetarian’ Divided into Vegetarian Is vegan Vegan Allowed only, milk and dairy products Lacto Allowed only eggs Ovo , Eggs, milk, dairy products Lacto Ovo Belongs. All of them do not eat meat, fish and seafood.
'Semi-vegetarian', which allows fish and seafood, eats milk, brown, fish and algae except red meat. Polo And milk, brown and fish Pesco And usually vegan, but depending on the circumstances Flexitarian Divided into Nowadays, more and more people are choosing 'vegetarian' as their practice for personal health and environmental protection.
Hongdae & Sinchon

There are some vegetarian restaurants in Hongdae, the “diversity special zone” as “the liberation zone of youth.” The atmosphere is different from that of Jongno & Insa-dong. Is it cafe which can serve meal? You can enjoy the brown rice health specialty restaurant Slobi, located near Exit 9 of Hongik Univ. I looked at <Jack's Bean>.

First, Sloby is the closest to Hongik University Station. At that time, the table is the most popular. We serve simple house rice with soup and some side dishes. It is popular as a dining place for those who aim for 'vegetarian' and 'healthy'.
Inside the sloppy
The Monday meal, which can be tasted only on Mondays, is only available as a vegetarian. At that time, he will show him a meal table (8000 won), assorted mushroom rice bowls (8000 won), fire (thong) meat bowl (8000 won), and then curry (8000 won).
Hongdae Café Slobby's most popular menu “Then That Time”
Vegetarians and non-vegetarians can "healthy eat" together.
Mushroom bowl of Slobby which is popular among modern people who want healthy food
Next is Sukara, located on the first floor of the Sanwoolim Small Theater in front of Hongdae. A new world unfolds with the menu board. In addition to the main dishes, desserts such as cakes, drinks and ice cream are also available for vegans. For those who don't eat milk, they also have soy milk drinks, a variety of fruit juices, tea, decaffeinated coffee, and organic wines.
Inside Sukhara, located on the 1st floor of Sanwoolim Small Theater
Of course, not only drinks, but also a la carte dishes such as meals and snacks are also available. Homemade natural yeast bread (5,000 won) for vegan, natural yeast bread and brown rice soup plate (12,000 won), Shinan village for fermented vegetarian cheeses (11,000 won), seasonal vegetable vegetables whole wheat pasta (12,000 won) and butter chicken curry (11,000 won) are also available. All menu items are available except cheese omelets, wholemeal pasta, and today's menus (12: 00-15: 00, 17: 30-20: 00).
Tofu Cheese Cake
Healthy desserts such as summer fruit cakes, amaretto ice cream (7500 won), tofu cheesecake (6,000 won), and homemade yogurt parfait (7500 won) are also available.
Homemade Yogurt Parfait
Not far from the Sanwoolim Theater, there is a falafel specialty store called Jaxbin.
Falafel Platter
In Korea, chickpeas, which are not grown, are called `` Falafel '' by grinding garlic, onions, and parsley into round pieces. When you cut the crispy outside, you will find a fresh skin that tastes like croquette. There is no meat, but it seems to eat meat.
Middle Eastern Sauce with Olive Oil, Garlic, Hummus
The flavor is revived by grinding chickpea with ‘pallafel’ and adding hummus, a sauce from the Middle East with olive oil and garlic.
Hollow Bread without Additives, Pita
When ordering a menu, say “Vegan” and cook it. Falafel wrap (6500 won), falafel sandwich (4800 won), falafel salad (6500 won), hummus (4500 won), falafel platter (15,800 won).
Bean dish with chickpeas and cheese
Ah, Slunch Factory near Sangsu Station and Loving Hut in Sinchon are also vegetarian restaurants near Hongdae.
Sandwiches made with palafel and salad in pita
Insadong & Jongno next to Jogyesa Temple… From temple food shops to simple vegetarian shops
There are a lot of specialty restaurants around Jongno & Insa-dong, where Jogyesa Temple is located. Temple food, commonly referred to as “zebap,” is literally their food. According to the Buddhist doctrine that prohibits 'killing', it has a natural vegetarian diet and tastes without coming (green onions, garlic, soothe, leek, red cherries). The taste of modern man, who is domesticated by various seasonings and seasonings, is boring to the mouth, but after eating, many people find it comfortable and healthy. Hongger is a plant that is not available in Korea and bans onions in Korea.
Wood bean soup at temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In the area around Jogyesa Temple, there are vegetarian restaurants such as <Gallery> and <Bow Gong Gong>, where temple food is served as a course. Of course, there are also (relatively) inexpensive menus that can be enjoyed on weekday lunchtimes.
Sacheol Rejuvenation Bath at the temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In Gosang, you can taste buckwheat miso rice bowl (15,000 won), balwoo (19000 won, perilla sesame tofu and mushroom gangjeong), and offerings (29,000 won, burdock vegetables, sodam soybean, mushroom hotpot). . In Bawong Gongyang, which offers course dishes, you can enjoy lunch specials such as lotus leaf rice set meal (12,000 won) from 1:00 on weekdays.
Mushroom Gangjeong showed that vegetarian food is also delicious
In Kwagane Food, located in Tongin Market, just a short distance from Insa-dong, there will be regular foods such as Ssambap (12,000 won) and Ginseng Pork Bulgogi (9500 won). In Five World Flavors, you can enjoy vegetarian noodles (5500 won), plum sweet and sour pork (15,000 won), and bean cutlet (11,000 won).
Meal of <Bowoo Gongyang> course, lotus leaf rice and modern miso soup
The victory of Jogyesa Temple is also known among Shinto people. You can enjoy feast, bibimb noodles, and seaweed soup (4000 won) at a reasonable price. In temples, noodles are called seung seung. This means that the noodles are delicious enough to make the monk laugh.
Lotus leaf rice with fragrant lotus leaf scent
Have you heard of? Juice Cleanse Cleanses My Body
Finally, we introduce 'Klen's Juice', which excludes even the chewing taste. It is a popular detox diet that cleans the body with detox juice, which removes toxic substances from the body. The practice is to replace meals with juices squeezed with only vegetables and vegetables instead of rice. Juices made up of only vegetable and fruit juices taste better than you think. Depending on their physical condition, detox juices can be taken from 1 day to 2 weeks in length. It's gaining celebrity thanks to the stars who have seen dramatic diet effects with the Juice Cleanse program.
A variety of juices from Detox juice shop Energy Kitchen
There are specialized Klens juice bars in Gangnam area such as Bad Farmers and Energy Kitchen on Sinsa-dong Garosu-gil. Juice prices vary slightly depending on the ingredients, but are higher than franchise coffee shops. The idea of juice instead of rice would be filled with the juice name 'Sorry, my body' and 'Well you're good to live' disappeared. I just laughed and was so sorry to end.
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Health Bar

item.title: Seocho-gu, Seoul, Korea - Journey through the alleys of the city center
item.description:
Bangbaesai-gil Art Map <Photo courtesy of Kim Hee-Jung>

Journey through the alleys of the city center

Seocho-gu, Seoul, Korea

I think of traveling far away. However, it is urban travel that is becoming a new trend of travel for modern people who can hardly find a trip. Among them, a trip to an alleyway centered on a particular street brings new pleasures. Bangbae-dong in Seoul reminds us of a cafe alley, but there is a new way. Let's take a trip to fall with the 'Bangbae-dong Sai-gil', which is frequented up and down recently.

Bangbae-ro 42-gil, Seocho-gu, named 'Bangbaesai-gil'

The name 'bangbaesai-gil' is unique. The word "sai", meaning liver, means two or more relationships. It will be time and space to define between. In that sense, calling 42-gil as 'sai-gil' by Bangbae means not only spatial (geographical) relationship but also cultural and social relations among the people living there. Of course, '42' can be read as '시', so you can call it that way.
Saigil began to be known to the world when ten people who nested in this place tried to make the streets of culture and art. In less than two years, it has grown to a group of more than 30 people, and members participate in the form of talent donation. A representative example is the Saigil Art Map. It is the work of Kim Hee-jeong, a designer of a specialty packaging company called 'Aurum'. 'Saigil Map', drawn by hand, embodies the ideal of this street.

Quiet and secluded Bangbae-dong, what is it like?
Recently, many roads between Bangbae-dong have been reported through the media. On the holiday of the New Year's Day, I ate a late morning and went to Sai Gil. You can see signs such as 'Bangbae-dong 42-gil' and '1 ← 72' on the wall.
Different people have different tastes. Some people like crowded places, while others like quiet and secluded places. Garosu-gil was initially a secluded street, but now it's a good place for people who are turning into a complex street and want to look away. If you express Garosu-gil as a 'prose', you can say that Sai-gil is a poem. It is so quiet and secluded that it provides a space of thought.
Bangbaesai Road Signpost Address Sign
The Saigil Flea Market is held here every month from 11:00 to 5:00 on the second Saturday.
The 5th Bangbaesai-gil Festival Poster
Let's make your own creative work in the handmade workshop
As I walk down the street, I can see 'Perfume Studio'. A couple of college students appear to be counseling.
Perfume Base Showcase
When I open the door slightly and enter, I am making a fragrance for my girlfriend for my birthday. From over 100 bases and over 20 natural oils, perfume designers help design and name their own fragrances.
Perfume workshop products sold at flea markets
The second place to visit is Ceramica Paint, a ceramic hand paint workshop. As you enter the entrance, you'll find a wide variety of ceramics in different colors and shapes. Cerawalk not only offers pottery classes, but also theme-style birthday parties.
Cerawalk's colorful ceramics
You can also make your own pottery as a souvenir or gift. Draw a picture on the pottery, apply glaze and bake it in a hot kiln of more than 1,000 degrees. All of this is done in stores. On the other side of the store, you can buy pottery while making pottery.
Participants Hand Painted Porcelain Figurines
When I enter a la main, a leather workshop, I can hear the sound of a hammer. You can make your own leather bags, wallets and more to suit your style.
Leather Craft Workshop
There are also many workshops where you can make sewing classes and dolls.
Sculpture dolls on display at handmade
`` Suemade '', a custom-made jewelry shop and a needlework doll workshop, and `` le conte '', a handmade accessory shop with an eco-friendly sewing story, is recommended for children as well as adults.
Children in class
Home design shop that makes our home happy
There are many trendy European shops on the road, not only antique antiques. The home interior design editorial shop which is full of famous brands
One of the major stores is 'Ruming', which specializes in North European home interior accessories. Looking through the window, the interior of the store
Lumming's Interior Props
Also attracting attention is “Eight Colors”, which displays and sells products such as House Doctor, which is popular for kitchen and furniture accessories, and Meri Meri, which specializes in house party and children's products.
Kitchen utensils displayed on 8 color
Marmelo, a recently established import home and design company, is home to some of Europe's most famous wallpaper, fabrics and cushions.
Eco-Products
'Naenggigi', a kitchenware K-tableware specialty shop located in an imported brand shop, is unique. At the entrance of the store, chandeliers made from dozens of ceramics welcome guests. A single-use cup set that promotes a healthy diet is good enough to contain only what you need for both adults and children. Cold season
Cupboard ceramic chandelier
A step away from Bangbae-sai Road, you will find 'Iim Design', a home fashion design shop such as bedding, curtains and cushions, and 'Aurum', a gift and souvenir packaging craft design company. Ideal for special guests or events.
Cold set
Rest in a small alley gallery

Sometimes smaller but more secluded galleries can blow away the stress of urban life. There are many galleries such as Bangbae-gil. 'A factory' thinks about what kind of factory it is just by its name. Maybe a stands for art

a factory exhibit

Mina Atelier is small but can interact with the artist and appreciate the exhibits.

Mina Atelier exhibits
When you stop by Lisa and Jamie Atelier, the studios of two sisters who have gone on separate paths as singers and jewelry designers, I recommend you to buy a mobile phone case printed with the artist's work.
Lisa & Jamie Atelier Cover
You can feel the warmth and enthusiasm like the bread just saved from the toaster and the gallery toast, which plays a role as a discharge channel for young artists, is also a good place to visit.
Yoo Seong-sun Solo Exhibition at Toaster Gallery
Restaurants like galleries add to the fun of eating
Walking between two or three hours will leave your boat. I'm worried about what to eat. “Kelly Gallery & Restaurant” is eye-catching. As with most shops, the interior view through the window is a fascinating attraction. The interior is more of a gallery than an ordinary restaurant. The walls are filled with paintings, and both the table decoration and the layout are as pretty as the paintings. Ordered today's menu, duck kimchi fried rice and oil pasta. Each grain of fried rice is seasoned evenly with spicy flavors. Pasta feels alive and chewy. The combination of rich olive oil flavor, shrimp and garlic is also excellent.
Interior of Kelly Gallery Kitchen
There are pretty and delicate cakes on the cake showcase that are really questionable.
Cake made with Sugarcraft Craft
Nearby is Lari Café, a popular cake shop since 1992. The shops, like a living room in a fine English home, are comfortable and antique. Made with the finest ingredients, Lari cake melts like a snowflake the moment it is put in your mouth. I ordered a chiffon cake with half the sugar content.
Chiffon Cake and Coffee
The combination of moist and soft creamy taste and Americano using the finest beans creates a wave of emotion. Every time a coffee asks for a refill, it brings it to a new cup with a different design. In addition to the coffee, the cup tastes good.
Lari's Coffee
Bread lovers can't miss Lee Boulanger's French bread bakery. Baking fermented bread using flour and natural yeast imported from France without artificial additives. Representative bread is germinated brown rice bread that is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The kitchen is open, so it's fun to see the bread making process.
Gerlan Brown Rice Bread
Those who want to make cakes or macaroons can take a baking class at the Donna L. baking studio run by Le Cordon Bleu Patisserie. It is a great place to make and present special cakes for your children or special people.
Baking studio at patissier from le cordon bleu

item.title: Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea - Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti
item.description:
Enjoy a hearty meal at Casablanca

Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

Liberation Village, an exotic building with old buildings and old signs. If you walk a little further on this unfamiliar and familiar street, you will be waiting for Seoul in the 1960s, with a building on a steep hill. In the spring when the rain falls, I left for the pleasure of the Liberation Village.
Liberation Village, the name of the overseas Koreans who returned to their homeland in 1945 and the displaced people. No matter how you listen, this strange neighborhood is emerging as a hot street. Introducing the hot place of Haebangchon, where you can enjoy the charms different from Itaewon and Gyeongridangil, already filled with the smell of 2000s.
Is this liberation village? Morocco? Casablanca
In small spaces, people are gathering together. It's mostly foreigners too. Even the orderer is a charming foreigner with bushy beards, so it's easy to wonder if it's overseas. If you look back and outside, this is a liberation village.
Casablanca can always see foreigners loyal
Casablanca, run by two brothers from Morocco, has a taste of Moroccan that is so good that Daniel Tudor, author of 'A Country Who Lost Miracles, Lost Joy', said, 'It's much better than Itaewon's expensive food.' . Most of the ingredients and condiments used for the large and thick sandwiches for the price are real exhaust through their hands. We hope that foreigners can taste their hometown at an affordable price.
Figure of foreigner couple waiting for ordered menu
The simple yet generous ingredients in the savory, hot baguette are a good example of Morocco's intense and addictive exotic flavor. Shrimp sandwiches with Moroccan sauce and Harry's Hot Sauce are the most popular dishes! The Moroccan Chicken Sandwich, with its curry-flavored chicken and vegetables, is also available.
A simple yet rich sandwich from Casablanca's main menu
In addition, soup made from lentil beans, which are said to be good for health, and `` Makuda '', a potato croquette that is also enjoyed as a street food in Morocco, is also an unusual menu.
Lentil Soup Known as Health Food by Lee Hyo Ri
If you want a limited edition book, 'Storage Book & Film'
If exotic restaurants tempt you at the beginning of the liberation village, the world of those who are quietly living their lives without signboards over the steep hillsides raises questions. Among them, 'Storage Book & Film', which is located near the three-way intersection of emerging churches, is an independent bookstore that started with the sale of film cameras and has now expanded to the distribution of independent publications.
The shop is simple but there are a lot of treasures to see.
In addition to independent publications, the camera is based on various kinds of photo books. Independent magazine 'Walkjin' is a collection of photographs published by bookstore owners. Season 1, the last greeting with 22 episodes, consisted of 45-60 photographs of a city captured by one person. Is filling. If you want to participate, you can knock on the bookstore door.
A look at Storage Book & Film on a slope
In addition, there are various lectures related to publishing such as InDesign, book binding, and calligraphy. In particular, the four-week photo book making and independent publishing courses are solid enough to be consistently found by people.
Visitors who touch books for a long time and find their own books
Soapy genie where soap becomes work
In the past, there are various types of studios that look like hidden paintings between the alleys. Two years ago, when you open the door of the soap studio Sopizini, you will be greeted by the fragrances that make your sense of smell happy and the colors of the eyes strong.
Cutely decorated studio is cozy
The master's job is an English teacher. Soap making, a long-time hobby, became another happiness that can't be removed from life after five years since it started selling in flea markets. Not only the fragrance and color, but also the potency of each soap, her efforts go all the way to shine even more.
Emotional handmade soaps that can only be found in Sopigini
Like the British handmade cosmetics brand, Rush, we hope to become Korea's leading handmade soap brand beyond Haebangchon.
Showcase outside the studio
It is a warm spring day to hold hands with your loved ones. How about leaving your first outing with a liberation village where your senses as well as your eyes, nose and mouth are happy?
Sofignini owner making soap

item.title: Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea - The main character on TV is me, I do it! MBC WORLD Broadcast Theme Park [My Home Trip_Seoul]
item.description:
MBC WORLD Broadcast Theme Park Hall of Fame

The main character on TV is me, I do it! MBC WORLD Broadcast Theme Park [My Home Trip_Seoul]

Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea

It is a warm Chinese New Year where at least two generations and as many as four generations gather together to multiply happiness. Why don't you go out on your way home with your family? Seoul prepared for those who are home. Let's have fun at MBC WORLD broadcasting theme park where the space inside the TV spreads out right in front of you.
Infinite Challenge is in front of my eyes!
The station I thought only as a vague world becomes my world! MBC WORLD Broadcast Theme Park where you can meet the stars on TV and experience the shooting scene. Everyone who is interested in the broadcasting system and overseas tourists who have visited our country on the Korean wave are experiencing this place.
A place where you can see the history of MBC and broadcasting equipment
M
Props used by reporters at the Seoul Olympics
The best gift for tourists who visited K-Pop stars is the hologram concert. Hallyu stars such as Big Bang and Psy will be captivated when they reach out. You can enjoy a stage that is more dynamic with the effects of directing and effects that are difficult to realize on the general stage.
Children in virtual experiences playing roles in news experience studios
How about becoming a member of the 7th infinite challenge? In order to fulfill the mission received at MBC Yeouido's underground parking lot, he meets a horror special, Creepy Broadcasting Station, in his 360-degree virtual reality. Unexpected tricks lurking everywhere invite you into a creepy horror. In addition, you can go through the corner of the station with an announcer and walk the DMZ with Henry to experience the real experience.
VR experience to meet 360 degree virtual reality
There is also a news experience studio that solves the mystery of children dreaming of being broadcasters. Made in a reduced size, you can broadcast yourself as a PD, announcer or weathercaster. There is also an exciting corner where you can learn how to dance to popular singers or receive autographs with greetings from the stars.
I can receive an autograph by an email with the greeting of the star
GD and I are virtual couples!
C zone where G-Dragon can take pictures in the desired pose and make memories of singing with Kim Bum-soo. Located in the lobby of the first floor of the Media Center, it is a lively attraction space where you can join the stars in line with MBC's hot programs.
Posing with the virtual husband G-Dragon and one, two, three!
In the augmented reality recording studio of <I am a singer>, the stars of <I am a singer> such as Kim Bum-soo, Yoon Min-su, and Yoon-ha sing and sing with me. On the other hand, in our booth, you can go out with your favorite star and take photos of couples. In addition, King of Mask Singer, I Live Alone, and My Little Television are waiting for visitors.
'House alone' Cut with Gangnam!
Camera B is essential in Building B. The trick art that makes the experience vivid through three-dimensional drawing is made up of popular dramas such as <Infinite Challenge>, <The King of Mask Singers> and <Coffee Prince> and <The Moon of the Sun>.
Augmented Reality recording studio recording duet of “I miss you”
MBC WORLD Broadcast Theme Park where you can experience various aspects of the station with your family. On New Year's Day, let's have a good time here instead of chatting with rice cake soup at home. Young nieces will be filled with heart-feeling emotions, and adults will be given a memorable gift.
Zone B with various trick art
MBC WORLD broadcast theme park is open from 10:00 to 18:00. Admission is available 2 hours before closing. It is closed on New Year's Day, and online reservation is possible.
Zone B with various trick art

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - Christmas & New Year Hotel Packages “For Special Holidays”
item.description:
Christmas package presented at InterContinental Seoul <Picture Credit: InterContinental Seoul>

Christmas & New Year Hotel Packages “For Special Holidays”

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

The cold winds make us lighter in our pockets. Here is a little extravagant hotel package for you who have been running hard for a year. Let's take a look just in case. Who knows and will meet someone who wants to make use of the Christmas hotel package!

Grand Ambassador Seoul

The All About Eve package is ready for romantic Christmas Eve. Christmas dinner at the banquet hall on the 19th floor with a panoramic night view of Namsan Mountain is included. Starting at 429000 won. There is also a “sweet holiday package” for romantic time only. It consists of one night, a bottle of wine and sweet macaroons in a cozy superior room for 24 and 31 days. Starting at 25,9600 won. There is also a “Namsan Sunrise Package” where you can prepare for the New Year while watching the sunrise at Namsan, the symbol of Seoul. Coffee and hot packs are useful for trekking in Namsan, and two room service breakfasts and a sauna pass for relaxing after sunrise. Only one day on December 31st. Starting at 28,3800 won. All guests have free access to the hotel's swimming pool and fitness. VAT 10% not included. Inquiries and reservations 02-2270-3111.

https://grand.ambatel.com/seoul/main.amb

Christmas Package 'All About Eve' <Photo courtesy of Grand Ambassador>
Grand Hilton Seoul

Grand Hilton Seoul has prepared three “Love At Christmas” packages only for a week from 19th to 25th for those who dream of a sweet and romantic Christmas. 'Love et Christmas 1' includes a Deluxe Room, Happy Hour Promo, where you can enjoy a bottle of red wine and unlimited draft beer from 6 pm to 9 pm. 'Love Et Christmas 2' will have dinner tickets added to the upgraded room. If you're dreaming of a day in a junior suite, you can use Love At Christmas 3. The price starts from 220,000 won. Contact 02-2287-8400.
http://www.grandhiltonseoul.com/

▶ Lotte Hotel Seoul

Lotte Hotel Sogong Branch will be hosting the 2014 Christmas Warmth Package from December 24 to 26. Superior rooms, breakfast buffet, Lotte Hotel bear doll, Christmas cake and wine, and mini Christmas tree. The Sweet Package, which includes upgraded rooms for juniors, will have room service for two Christmas special dinners. From 390,000 won.

Christmas Package <Photo courtesy of Lotte Hotel Seoul>

There is also a Happy New Year 2015 package on the last day of the year. There are `` Basic Packages '' which include superior rooms, breakfast, New Year's cakes, Zolme dolls to celebrate the Year, and `` Suit Packages '' to enjoy meals in upgraded rooms. From 320,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-759-7311
http://www.lottehotelseoul.com/kr/

Happy New Year 2015 Package (Photo courtesy of Lotte Hotel Seoul)
Mayfield Hotel

At Mayfield Hotel, the Christmas & Year-end package My Sweet Heart is available in three versions from December 24 to 31. It includes a "sweet box" containing imported sweets, jelly and candy, and a "sweet heart delivery" mailing of love letters.
"My Sweet Heart" version 1 features a Superior Room and a Michelin 2-Breakfast Buffet, while version 2 offers Christmas headbands and Santa Helena wine for Christmas Eve customers only. Version 3 has Christmas Eve performances and dinners. Starting at 276,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-2660-9000.

http://www.mayfield.co.kr/

Grand InterContinental Seoul

Grand InterContinental Seoul has a "Christmas of Love" package that adds cinema to your hotel break. Packages for the modern people who want to enjoy both relaxing and cultural life in the city include a chocolate basket and a bottle of wine. It also offers tickets to the Winter Festival Christmas Market booth held in the COEX complex. There is also a 'Celebrating 2015 Package' for the new year. In 2015, you can enjoy unlimited wine at the lobby lounge of the hotel, based on healing in the city, and experience Bongeunsa and other fireworks. Christmas packages start at 305,000 won and New Year packages start at 295,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-3430-8888
https://www.grandicparnas.com:444/kor/index.do

Celebrating 2015 Package (Photo courtesy of InterContinental)
Imperial Palace Seoul

Imperial Palace Seoul has prepared an “In the mood for love” package for a romantic Christmas in the heart of the city. Includes room, breakfast, real wood candle & saucer set. If you choose a room as a suite, room service such as wine, pizza, chocolate, and mini cakes is added. There is also an “In the Mood for Love-Special Eve” package where you can enjoy Christmas parties in your room. This is a special package that includes two tickets to the Lobby Lounge Del Mar's Christmas party in the “In the mood for love” package. There is also a New Year's Eve package that will allow you to enjoy the year-end party and the New Year. Christmas packages start at 290,000 won and New Year packages start at 220,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-3440-8000.
http://www.imperialpalace.co.kr/

item.title: Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea - Wait for the horse! Samgyetang & Freshwater Eel
item.description:
Horse-free food, grilled freshwater eel

Wait for the horse! Samgyetang & Freshwater Eel

Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea

It's summer. Even if you are still sweating. Both slim and serious people need to take care of themselves in the heat. Samgyetang, which helps smooth gastrointestinal function and eel, has been found for recovery. All are low fat and high protein. If you listen to it, your arms and legs are strong. If you eat too much to take care of your body, however, you may be afflicted with oversized flesh. There is still a word.

Samgyetang is one of the first hands to be a summer food. Samgyetang is a chicken that has fallen in the water that everyone would have tasted if they had been born and raised on this land. When the hot days swelling in the heat or when the body is desolate, the chicken baeksook was carefully pampered. When you get sick in the West, you eat chicken soup, so chicken seems to be indispensable.

Do you eat samgyetang in Seoul?
Samgyetang (蔘 鷄湯), as the name adds chicken and ginseng, jujube, garlic, etc. are added. Trim the chicken clean and add glutinous rice, garlic and jujube to your stomach to pour water and boil. Sambok-myeon is more visited thanks to the summer's representative lifestyle. Chicken, ginseng, and glutinous rice are added to the abalone or other tonic ingredients.
<Local Village> whole view
Samgyetang is a national treasure that requires no explanation. Samgyetang is not my mother's orphan, but I searched for Samgyetang specialty store that is not a problem in the hot weather. When you're tired and tired of being hit by a living, and you're feeling hot, let's go to `` chicken broth for the soul. ''
Samgyetang
First of all, you don't need to talk. The legendary samgyetang restaurant is famous as the president's regular house. It is difficult to avoid waiting in line whether or not there are many people. It is hard to expect friendly service because there are many people looking for it. Nevertheless, foreign tourists join in, and the number of guests is overflowing. Not only ginseng and glutinous rice, but also other herbs are added, and the soup is heavy and fragrant. Good for those who like rich flavors.
Samgyetang of <Jangan Samgyetang>
Next is Goryeo Samgyetang, located in Seosomun-dong. You can see Samgyetang specialty shops with the same name. Kori Samgyetang, which boasts more than half a century of tradition, is located in Seosomun and Sejong-ro. Thanks to the clear and plain broth, women prefer it. Changan Samgyetang is located in the same city hall. Changan Samgyetang, which is characterized by its uniqueness, appeals to the nearby workers with its ordinary weapons. <Koryo Samgyetang> is easy to find if you come out of Subway City Hall Station Exit 7 and <Jangan Samgyetang> Exit 10. In addition, Gangwonjeong and Singil-dong's Lake Samgyetang, located in the alley of Yongsan Police Station, are specialty shops that cannot be missed.
Goryeo Samgyetang, located at Exit 10 of City Hall Station
Cheap and hearty chicken one kalguksu
If the samgyetang introduced above is 'classic', there is a 'chicken drowned' that you can enjoy more casually. One chicken kalguksu. On the opposite side of Gwangjang Market and behind Dongdaemun Market, there are grilled fish houses and a chicken house. It is easy to understand when you think about Samgyetang that appears in the yangpon. It is also good to be able to take care of the body at a lower price, but the taste of boiling fresh kimchi into the broth is also amazing.
One chicken noodle soup with one chicken
One more thing is that it can be manufactured according to taste and taste. The downside is that it's too hot. Unlike the already cooked samgyetang boiled in front of the fire to eat because you can not avoid the heat. Nevertheless, sweating and sensation of the heat of fever, and one chicken flicking off the power of the limbs will be burned.
If you want to taste it, add kimchi
Depending on your taste, add seasoning, garlic and sour kimchi to boil. Don't forget the kalguksu, which is boiled in the remaining broth after all the chickens have been eaten. The charm of one chicken kalguksu is that two chickens can be boiled for a bowl of samgyetang. Several specialty shops are gathered, starting with <Jinokhwa Mae-mae-dong Chicken>. If you don't like chickens that are drowning in water, you can also boil your body with Andong Braised Chicken, Chicken Stir-Fried Tang, ‘치네 님’, or chicken.
Andong Braised Chicken with Vermicelli
Nourishing tofu NO.1 eel, does it really work?
Next is freshwater eel. The taste is also delicious but is popular as a natural nourishing tonic. If you chew one eel in your mouth, you can see for yourself how high he is. The succulent but juicy gravy! But the price is not formidable. Expensive too expensive It usually costs over 70,000 won per kg. Some may sell maridans. It also costs 3 to 40,000 won, which is definitely not a light food. Park salaries are either big hearted or earned, or mostly one of them. You don't have to pass it until it's natural. Only if you're not a good gourmet can you see the subtle differences. You should be able to taste it enough. Here are some of the most popular eel shops for luck days.
First, Chungmuro's <Rabbit>. It has been active as a grilled eel specialty store for nearly 30 years. Office workers around are looking for a relatively cheap lunch. 2kg per 1kg and two people can taste the eel. Closed Sundays and holidays. Another famous spot is Ilmi Eel, located in the alley of Byucksan building across from Seoul Station. Weekends and holidays are all off. Business hours are 11: 30 ~ 13: 00, 17: 30 ~ 21: 00.
Freshwater eel grilled without a horse
Gourmets say that 200g per eel is the most delicious, but the eel that can't be eaten has a sweet 1kg eel. The eel that climbs 5 kg is called “Omi eel,” and gourmets who want to taste it can find “Namseoul Freshwater Eel” located in Novotel Gangnam. Two must eat three. Business hours are from noon to 10 pm. Holiday closed.
If you finish your body of '이열치열', why don't you finish it with cool shaved ice? Cool down your sweat, cool down your mouth, and soothe your mouth in the summer.
Freshwater eel grilled without a horse

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?
item.description:
Kung Fu Panda Po in front of the Seoul Museum of Art

Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

To the terrible kingdoms of Shrek and Fiona, to Qing Qingshan where the Kung Fu Panda Po was born, and to the Viking village of Burke where dragons fly. How were these places that seemed to exist somewhere in the world? If you're curious about the wonderful story and background that caught our eye, start here at DreamWorks Animation Special!
Dreamworks reveals the inner skin of animation
The characters in the movie move my way! DreamWorks Animation Special Exhibition, where Kung Fu Panda 'Sipu Sabu' makes you smile and you are waiting for a wonderful experience of Burk Island with Dragon 'Twosley'. This exhibition, which takes place from April 30 to August 15 at the Seoul Museum of Art, is an interesting event for anime enthusiasts.
The timid giraffe Melman of Madagascar
From the entrance of the museum, the big `` po '' greets you, and at the entrance of the exhibition, the dragon `` Twosleys '' greets you. This is where 20-year-old blood sweat animations are revealed.
Melman's cute face can be found inside the exhibition hall
You can see about 400 works of various types, from initial concept drawings to storyboards, original paintings, 3D characters and set models, movie scores, and masks.
Audiences Watching the Animation Exhibition
As you can see, it adds to the seasoning of each person in charge.
You can also see the initial animation in video
From sketch to screen

This exhibition is not just a place to introduce works. In order to look at the various collaborative work and the whole process to complete the animation one by one, it introduces it into three fields: character, story, and world.

Initial appearance and completion of current characters
There are various sketches on the wall of the character section that show how the initial idea was born as a character through concept drawing and sketching. Looking at the initial sketches, the character on the screen is unimaginably different and uncooked.
Visitors viewing various sketches
Familiar characters made of clay or plaster greet the audience in a transparent box.
Inside of special animation
Children also have no time to be bored. The Face Poser corner, where you can make facial expressions of famous characters, including Sifu Sabu from Kung Fu Panda, is perfect for children who are interested in art to raise their animators' dreams by changing their facial expressions.
Corner Face Poser to change the look of characters
What about the process of telling stories to these characters? The story section captures the eyes as if the artists were working and just moved away from the studio. Hundreds and thousands of storyboards, as well as video, convey the progress intact. In particular, the 'pitching' video, which conveys the story vividly like a grandmother who told a story in her childhood, is a must-see point!
Storyboards full of walls
The last section of the world is full of fun. There are numerous studies and worries to express the worldview of each piece in a realistic way. In particular, the best way to experience this exhibition is Bird's Eye View! Like the main character 'hiccup' in the taming of the dragon, it is mysterious as if flying on the back of the dragon 'Twosleys'.
Moved the animation studio table
DreamWorks' animation is not just for children. Dreams, hopes, and courage are the works that have been loved by the public by melting the values that humans should always pursue. Let's take a look at how these works are made and experience the true courage of children and the precious dreams that adults have forgotten. Your tomorrow will change anew.
The movie theater dragon flight which can experience bird eye view
