item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure
item.description:
Korean Food Center

K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Modern man lives in a flood of information. Nevertheless, many people are thirsty for real information. Why? Isn't it because information comes to life only when it is connected to the person who needs it? Modern people living in a society where travel is routine and online 24 hours a day are no exception.
K-Style Hub, which opened on April 11, is a new style hub that can show Korean taste and fashion to both Koreans and foreigners. Experience of Korean food and Korean culture, as well as travel information on every corner of Korea, the best veteran travel experts in Korea provides one-on-one travel counseling services.
K-Style Hub, located in the office building of Seoul Tourism Organization, Jung-gu, Seoul, consists of 1,300 pyeong of space on four floors. On the second floor, you can get information on Hallyu and medical tourism, as well as travel information in every corner of Korea. Provide tourism information using Korea's advanced information and communication technology (ICT). If you miss the analog information, you can consult the information desk.
Tourist Information Center
If you are familiar with digital media, you can use digital kiosks, tablets, etc. to get the information, and you can also enjoy the information of the destinations taken by drones.
360 degree view screen
In addition, you can experience Korea's travel destinations right in front of you at the Oculus Experience Center using Virtual Reality (VR), as well as the lively photography corner with Hallyu stars such as Psy using Augmented Reality (AR).
VR experience
You can also enjoy skiing at the Pyeongchang Olympic Ski Jump, which will be held in Gangwon-do in 2018. If you can tolerate some dizziness, like a real ride.
K-Star Photo Zone
Take the escalator to the third floor. Korean Food Experience Center is located. It is also a space to learn about Korean food and food culture through Korean seasons and customs using Korean ICT technology. Along the entrance walls built with traditional Korean timber stacking methods, our seasonal foods printed on Korean traditional grate doors and windows are neat and stylish.
24 seasons and three customs
In the air at the far end of the 24 seasons passage, you can hear a drop of water dropping onto the pottery head and its waveform is projected on the wall. It is a moment when water, the source of life, which is so common and never felt its presence, feels mysteriously.
Head and Ingredients
You can then touch the various cereals, beans and spices in Korea and smell them with your nose. Behind the experience table, Jangdogdae brings back memories of Jangdogok that you played while playing hide-and-seek as a child. The voice yelling, "Hide it, I see your hair," wanders in my ears.
Traditional Changdokdae
On the other hand, three kimono cubes are placed in the middle of the exhibition hall.
Media show using Onggi lid
In the first cube, it is an experience space where you can open our seasonal ingredients one by one as you open the medicine cabinet drawer. The chest of drawers filled with harvested seasonal ingredients resembles our traditional barn. Next to it is a scarecrow hologram, standing alone in an empty rice paddy after an autumn harvest.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
In the second cube, you can turn the handle by hand and read the book about Korean food, and the 9-sided Korean plate on our lacquer plate is round and round, and next to it is a modernization symbolizing harmony and balance of Korean food. There is a traditional Hansang experience corner. Again, turn the handle to line up the colors underneath the food, and the four foods are neatly laid out on a wide plate. It is a modernized Korean style dress considering balanced color and balanced nutrients and calories.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
The final cube is a fixture symbolizing the value of convergence, one of the characteristics of Korean food. We show the charm of our bibimbap, that is, the beauty of fusion, which makes good use of the characteristics of unique ingredients while mixing and blending together to create a new taste through a work that sublimates various ingredients into artistic beauty.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Arirang resonates from the left side, and images form on 96 caps. Various patterns of Korean food and various foods that accompany them are projected, and the four seasons of Korea are depicted in ink paintings on the wall and over the fence. Korea's advanced ICT convergence technology utilizes our traditional Onggi to create beautiful works of art.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Let's go up one floor again. The courtyard surrounded by elegant hanok looks quiet. It is a Korean food experience center.
Korean Food Experience Center
Here you can taste the representative foods of Korea. You can buy food made from rice and beans, North Korean food, and various types of rice cakes and desserts in Korea.
Soybean Jeonbeak
At the Korean Food Center, 40 people can simultaneously experience Korean cuisine. In addition to our court food, Jongga food, temple food, Kimchi and Bulgogi, various cultural experiences can be arranged through reservation.
Traditional liquor
It is a space where master classes for famous chefs at home and abroad, as well as beginners, can easily make Korean food.
Chinese tourists taking cooking lessons at Korean Food Center
In addition to Korean cultural products, such as food and crafts, products from various fields created by small and medium-sized venture companies in Korea can be purchased at one place. In the middle of the store, works of hanbok that express the beauty of our hanbok are displayed, and next to it are various hanbok products that can be worn in real life.
Art market selling excellent cultural products
The newly opened K-Style Hub is creating a new paradigm of exhibition culture by combining the world's best ICT technology with our culture.
Venture Business Product Promotion Zone
In terms of design, it is a new landmark of Korean tourism that shows the excellence of our culture and art through beautiful harmony of black and white.
Sun + line + line by Han Young-hee, Hanbok writer
Travel info

K-Style Hub
http://korean.visitkorea.or.kr/kor/bz15/kstylehub/overview.jsp

-Address: 2F ~ 5F, Seoul Office Building, 40, Cheonggyecheon-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul
-Opening Hours: Tourist Information Center (Open all year round, 09: 00 ~ 20: 00), Korean Food Experience Center closed every Tuesday, 10: 00 ~ 18: 00
-Admission fee: Free (Korean food experience hall on the 4th floor sells food for a fee, and cooking class is operated by advance reservation.)
-Tel: Tourist Information Center (02-729-9497 ~ 9499), Korean Food Experience Center (02-6053-7177 ~ 79)

item.title: Nowon-gu, Seoul, Korea - Spring date to the foot of Suraksan
item.description:
Entering Suraksan Nowongol and Cheonsangbyeonggil, where you can leave from Suraksan Station

Spring date to the foot of Suraksan

Nowon-gu, Seoul, Korea

As spring approaches, we have a date course where you can take a gentle walk and a cup of hot coffee. When we say 'mountain', we often think of 'Hasanju', but if it's the same time as the spring breeze is blowing, wouldn't it be better to add 'tea' instead of 'sake'? I left the early spring outing with a walk and a cup of tea at Suaksan Mountain located in Uijeongbu and Nowon-gu, Gyeonggi-do.

Located between Sanggye-dong, Nowon-gu, Seoul, and Uijeongbu-si, Gyeonggi-do, Suraksan (638m) is a mountain that is beloved by citizens along with Bukhansan, Dobongsan, and Bulamsan. The seemingly muscular rock walls may make hiking a burden, but pickling is not so harsh. Professional mountaineers can enjoy hiking in the mountains of Bulam ~ Suraksan ~ Dobongsan ~ Bukhansan, but it is enough to enjoy one by one.

Suraksan next to the apartment, popular as a health course for residents
Suraksan trekking can be started at Danggo Open Station, Suraksan Station, and Mangwol Station. Today, I plan to add a cup of hot tea after a gentle spring walk, so I headed to Suraksan station where some pretty cafes are gathered. The trekking course is Cheonsang Byeong-gil, which connects to the entrance of Nowongol, Nogungol Yaksu, Nobungol Crossroads, Dosolbong, and Summit. Of course, you don't necessarily have to go to the top. A walk is enough. It still enters a mountain path with cold wind.

The light is over, but the trees are bare and the ground is frozen. Still, the spring energy is mixed with 2% and it is exciting. Even on weekdays, those who visited the mountain are quite visible. The colorful attire of the hikers illuminates the achromatic mountains that have not yet been replaced with spring clothes.

Nowongol Crossing Road-Dosolbong Peak
After taking the walk in Suraksan, I started to explore the cafe street. The longer the stay in the mountain, the higher the chance that the tea would turn into sake. The entrance to Nowakgol in Suraksan is a residential space that combines apartments, villas and detached houses. Various restaurants, cafes, and climbing equipment stores fill the streets between Nowongol Avenue and residential spaces.
Suaksan Shelter, located just before the trail begins
Cafes digging through the mountains
When you descend from the mountain to the plain, you will find a variety of restaurants. The fun that is different from the fun in the mountains begins now. Just a few years ago, the number of climbing equipment stores that filled this place, along with restaurants, was noticeably reduced.
Acceptance Gate located at the beginning of Suraksan Nowongol
Did the cafes fill the space? There are many cafes including <Coffee Tree Scent>, <Buk Café Village>, <Coffee Potty One>, <Cafe Haru>, and <Cafe Sagye>. Where would the cafes come from only mountaineers? I'm curious. When did cafes start to settle here?
From here, there are restaurants, cafes, and so on.
It's a cafe digging into the foot of the mountain. Live clubs, such as the Acoustic Guitar Cafe, have often been seen, but it's not long since the cafes have entered the foothills.
Protagonists making Nowongol a “cafe street” <Coffee Tree>
“It must have been about two or three years ago. Coffee shops started to appear one by one. Why are there so many coffee shops on the east coast? The sea and coffee go well together, but there weren't many cafes in the mountains. There were many homes where I could add Hassan. Then as more and more coffee shoppers entered the cafe. There are more people who want to take a break and have a cup of tea in the airy foothills. I still have many locals, lovers on a date and friends to talk. ”
Home Bunny, near Suraksan Station
A great date course with a variety of tea and brunch menus
It is explained by the owner of the cafe in Nowongol, Suraksan. One more thing was added to the evolution of cafes, where you can enjoy tea and coffee, as well as snacks. There is also a brunch menu for young people. In Café Haru, you can taste burgers and Americano for 6,000 won and honey bread and two Americano for 10,000 won.
Café Haru with a variety of food such as hamburgers
Coffee Potty One, a famous pancake, has a set menu that includes two pancakes and an Americano.
The main characters that make Nowongol a 'cafe street' <Coffee Potty One>
Sweet waffles that interfere with diet and a simple breakfast bagel are also popular cafes.
Hot cake of Coffee Forty One
There are no large coffee chains in Suraksan Cafe Street. Independent cafés reveal their individuality and keep their seats.
A bagel set that is equal to a simple meal
Book Cafe Village, which is a new apartment complex that has been accepted, is a cultural space operated by village residents and serves as a love room for village residents.
Sweet bread with sweet taste
I feel like my heart is knocking on the door and want to sit down for a while. You can also enjoy cafes all day here. When spring comes, I'll have to prepare a simple lunch box. The taste of the lunch on the mountain can't be followed. Why don't you take a light stroll, visit a delicious cafe, and enjoy the upcoming spring with a good person? Sit side by side at the cafe and share a cherry blossom song. Spring, welcome!
Book Cafe Village run by villagers
Travel info

1. Nearby restaurants

Cafe Haru: 11 Dongdae-ro 242-gil, Nowon-gu / Haru Burger, Coffee, Beverages / 02-6332-1024

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - National delicacies in Seoul!
item.description:
Just look at the mouthwatering visual Jeonju grandmother Bibimbap

National delicacies in Seoul!

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Seoul is home to people from all over the country. Even if you miss the cozy hometown flavor or the exotic menus you've eaten at your destination, you can't leave because of your busy life. For those, I found restaurants that properly describe the local flavors in Seoul.
Jeonju Yu Grandmother Bibimbap
In Bukchang-dong Eatery Alley, which has been changing for a long time, it has been operating for over 50 years. Grandmother's own sesame oil is filled with a spoonful of jeongjeonyu grandmother Bibimbap.
Opened in 1962 by Grandmother Yu Ho Je, Jeonju, under the name of Jeonju House, the restaurant's main menu is Bibimbap and Bean Sprout Gukbap. But for decades, it's been so good that it's been a staple.
Now the daughter-in-law, who inherited the family, instead of her grandmother, carefully wraps a spoonful of sesame oil in a sizzling boiling stone pot. The amount of herbs is so much that you can't see the rice, and it's more special thanks to the egg yolk, which makes your hands thinner instead of ups and downs. All this goes well with gochujang made from ingredients that have been handed down from home! When rubbing, the key is to mix the texture with chopsticks instead of a spoon.
Jeonju Yu Grandmother Bibimbap with a taste that meets expectations
Another Jeonju local food, Kimchi Bean Sprout Soup, can't be eaten without taste.
Kimchi Bean Sprout Soup with spectacular boiling water
Crunchy bean sprouts, eggs, kimchi and rice combine to create a rich and harmonious taste. Unlike the clean Seoul style, it is seasoned with shrimp sauce to add a deep taste.
Ripe bean sprouts are so popular that it's easy to eat as a haejang
Enjoy fresh dumplings! Personality
There is a place in Seoul that makes the gyoza dumplings that are more unfortunate. Opened in 1967, it's a personality collection that maintains a consistent taste At this starting point is Kim Young-hee's grandmother. This house started with a round snack with wine snacks, and rumors started to grow with regulars. Although her grandmother, Kim Young-hee, died, her daughter-in-law, Moon Hyun-jin, keeps the taste as it is.
This dumpling is a real personality dumplings!
In general, the thinner the dumpling skin is, the more delicious it is. If the dumplings are thicker, they will taste less flour if cooked less thickly, and will be fuller if miscooked. However, this unique dumpling skin is surprisingly soft and moist. It's good to dip it in the intestine, but if you eat it with a spoon and sprinkle it on top of the dumplings, the liver will be soaked in moderately deeper taste.
Sprinkle with sauce to taste even deeper
Beef is fresh as well as meat, thanks to the generous amount of vegetables. The zucchini, which is characteristic of Kaesong dumplings, is full of chewy taste.
Kaesong dumplings filled with meat and vegetables
The highest peak of this house is by far the personalized Oisobak. Sheathed the cucumbers and put the ingredients simply soaked like Dongchimi. The combination of crispy texture and cool broth of cucumber ice cream is amazing.
Cool taste is a gem of personality pickled cucumber
Kaesong Sundae, which has been washed with inverted pig intestines several times and filled with plenty of vegetables, meat and vegetables, is also a sign of the house. As you chew, it pops in your mouth and scatters gently. The savory and chewy taste is more like homemade sausage than Sundae.
Various menus that make full use of individuality
In addition, various unique foods such as homemade chewy tteok-teokguk and Donggrang-tuk, reminiscent of meat jeon, have a unique taste.
Various menus that make full use of individuality
Goseong Makguksu (buckwheat noodles) with 100% taste of buckwheat
There is a place in the outskirts of Seoul, but it is not an exaggeration to say that no one knows if it is a makguksu enthusiast. Goseong Makguksu is a place that brings out the extremes of taste by adding Dongchimi to the simplicity of buckwheat noodles.
Buckwheat is more nutritious than other grains because it contains more protein. However, buckwheat is easily broken when heated. Made from 100% pure buckwheat, it is plucked out immediately upon receipt of the order to give its guests an elastic side. Noodles as thin as noodle are made with buckwheat's own coarse texture, yet convey the scent of buckwheat.
Goseong Makguksu comes with Dongchimi and Noodles separately
Dongchimi broth is also the heart of the house! It is made every morning and stored at room temperature for one day before it ages in the fridge. Cool Dongchimi soup is refreshing and sweet instead of seasoning intensity. If you pour Dongchimi soup with flesh ice, it is the best combination in itself. Bibim Makguksu is also a non-irritating seasoning so you can fully enjoy the taste and subtle aroma of buckwheat itself.
If you put Dongchimi with ice in a ladle, you'll be born a fantastic water buckwheat noodles!
Knitting is a taste that can not be missed. Gangwon-do Samhab is another specialty that is spicy and spicy and wears cold in the mouth, and adds white kimchi with crisp texture. Yeolmu Kimchi and Baek Kimchi are soaked once a week and matured in the basement.
Knitting to Fascinate the Mouth
If you're tired of traveling on weekends with warm spring scents, plan a city trip where you can casually taste and enjoy the local flavors. The taste of the filling of your mouth will give you another happiness.
The combination of knitting, white kimchi, and codfish is a delicacy.

item.title: Nowon-gu, Seoul, Korea - The King of Joseon Dynasty, where 'Naesi' slept, is thrilled even in midsummer! Mount Naesi, Seoul Draft
item.description:
Mun In-seok and Sang-seok of Chosun Myeons

The King of Joseon Dynasty, where 'Naesi' slept, is thrilled even in midsummer! Mount Naesi, Seoul Draft

Nowon-gu, Seoul, Korea

Choansan Mountain (114m) is located in Changdong-dong, Dobong-gu and Wolgye-dong, Nowon-gu. On the surface, it looks like a garden near the house, but when you enter it, there are many paths between the lush bushes. Thanks to this, it is loved as a walking course for the locals. Here, you can see the tombs of four generations and eunuchs in Joseon Dynasty scattered around Choansan Mountain and add “study history”. Introducing the Mt. Naesi, a creepy mountain of Mt.

How did the eunuchs live?
Before we enter the draft, let's take a look at the lives of today's heroes 'Naesi'. Give it up. A castrated king's man who appears in movies or dramas with the king. In Joseon's palace, the king's woman, “My List” and the king's man, “Nasibu” existed.
Choansan Tomb of the Joseon Dynasty
There are quite a few stories about “my name book” in which the king's concubines and court ladies belong to. In contrast, there aren't many stories about endopsies. 'Naesibu', the dictionary, is introduced as 'a government office in charge of meals in the royal court of the Joseon Dynasty and the delivery of the royal name.' All staff were appointed by officials, and the chief crest of the inner city was the second merchant vessel, which served as the king's meal and attendant secretary. The second piece is the fourth product line in the Joseon Dynasty. It shows a different power from the image that was evoked. Of course, it may be a bit lower than the “Women's women” who were able to go up to the first item, but the “men of the kings” who stayed close to the king's closest side also enjoyed a lot of power.
Fallen Headstones and Superiors
140 seats in the inner city. They were the only male archers who were in charge of housekeeping, including the food and cleaning of the palace, and the royal family, including the king and queen. They were castrated and could not play a male role. Nevertheless, those who came to power as "men of the king" marryed and adopted their families. Various unpleasant events led to the appeal of subordinates against the marriage of the eunuchs, but thanks to the royal court, the eunuchs also enjoyed a "marriage life."
It is a common scene in Chosun-gun tomb of Choan-san.
Abandoned Mysteries
A good time too. The grave where the eunuchs are asleep is terrible. It is incredibly ugly to believe that one day they lived without a blemish at the side of the king.
From Wolgye-dong to the summit of Choan-san
Maybe it wasn't a 'real blood line'. Sleeping without a descendant to take care of the eunuchseongungun is not managed at all.
Promenade leading to the summit at the Choanshan Changgol District
A stone monument, a mangstone, a cut-throat copper magnet, and a Moon-seok stoned by the abandoned tomb are lonesome.
The bush is lush and you can take a cool walk in the middle of summer.
Chosunsan Joseon Dynasty's Tomb Myeon (No.440) is a starting point for Wolgye High School in Nowon-gu, Wolgye-dong.
Sperm to rest near the summit
The address is San 8-3, Wolgye-dong, Nowon-gu, Seoul. If you look at the Joseon Dynasty cemetery exhibited in Biseokgol Neighborhood Park, which is located on the playground of Wolgye High School, you will be able to have a more substantial “History of Joansan History”.
Summit Heliport
The expedition of Choonsan Joseon Dynasty's excursion began at Biseokgol Neighborhood Park.
In the Seokgol Valley neighborhood park, stones near Choonsan Joseon Dynasty's tombs are gathered. Mun-seok, Mang-seok, Bronze, Sang-seok, and Tombstones dressed in bokbok and brass clothing are displayed as they are. Mangjuseok, which plays a role in recognizing the tomb from a distance, refers to a pillar of stone standing in front of the tomb. In addition, the small magnet with a cute stature with a small stature is enshrined for those who have excellent academic achievements but who have not climbed the ground or who are the owners of the grave below.
Biseokgol Neighborhood Park located on the playground of Wolgye High School
Moon Seok, who guards the tombs, has changed in shape, size, and form according to the times. In Choansan where Joseon Dynasty was located, you can see Moon Seok Seok dressed in bokdu and brass robes. First abdominal hunger. Bokdu is the coffin used by the former Joseon Dynasty's past disciples when they received a red card. The brass vest means the robe of the Munmu White, which was worn in the ordinances and the auspicious things of a hat decorated with gold. Comparing the two quickly reveals the difference. It is enough to prepare for a visit to Choansan Tomb Myeon if you look for the “stone” made of wide stones and the “stone monument” made to praise the deceased and pass it on to future generations.
The left side is hungry stomach, the right side is brass suit
As you enter Choansan Mountain at the Seokgol Valley Neighborhood Park, you will be greeted by copper magnets with cut necks. Walk back with a sign indicating 1.1km to the summit.
Copper magnet smaller than Moon Seok
On the road, as well as the side of the road, left untouched, Moon-seok and Mang-seok are connected. There are many things that can't be recognized. The tomb, apparently abandoned, is also visible. Even though he dies, his loyalty to the palace leads him to the unknown.
A monument to honor the statues of the elders and those who slept.
Is that so? The summer day when the heat wave was released, but the Chosun-gun Joseon Dynasty's grave is shady. It is not a high mountain, but the bush is thick and the sun does not leak. Is it because of the feeling that it suddenly creeps through the abandoned graves? When you get to the top, you breathe in thanks to people who enjoy aerobics to the exciting music. Soon after the helipad, the sperm of the summit of Choansan will come out. Squeeze your neck for a while at the simple top without a cover.
Draft Sanan, a popular walk for locals
From the summit, you can go down to Nokcheon Station, Choansan Changgol District, or Wolgye High School. Choansan (산 安 山), which means `` determine a comfortable resting place, '' is as soft and quiet as its name. It may be because of this that the cemetery which transcended status was established in Joseon Dynasty which was a strict status society.
Broken and neglected stone statue
The villagers held a ritual to appease the eunuchs here every fall, even during the Japanese colonial rule. Since 2013, he has been hosting the 'Duansan Cultural Festival' in Nowon-gu, Seoul to appease the eunuch and the spirits.
Broken and neglected headstone

item.title: It is good even if it is cold! With a sled!
item.description:
Exciting Children Sledding Down the Snow

It is good even if it is cold! With a sled!

Gwangjin-gu, Seoul, Korea

Prepared for those who have been sick in the long winter. You can feel free to play with a light pocket. In addition, it is easily reached by public transportation in downtown Seoul. Introducing a half-day winter playground for everyone of all ages, including sledding and skating rinks in Seoul.

You must be close. Feel free to reach even by public transport. It's because you have to be able to run anytime without having a big heart like a ski resort at the foot of the mountain. To get children up, convenient transportation is a must. This is also true of the two dating families. What if you could easily find it by public transport anytime and spend an exciting day this winter without spending a lot of money?
Ears are brushed. In Seoul Seoul Plaza Skating Rink First of all World Cup Park Ice Sledding Ground, Ttukseom River Park Snow Sledding Ground, Boramae Park Ice Sledding Ground, Nodeul Garden Ice Sledding Ground, Garden Five Ice Garden, Guro Anyangcheon Snow Sledding Ground, Sangam MBC Skating Ground, Seoul Land Sledding Ground, Yangjaecheon Ice Sledding Ground, Dorimcheon Children's Sledding Ground, Jungnangcheon Skating rink and children's hall This place. While looking for a sledding range to enjoy the day, I decided to visit the Ttukseom River Park sledding range and the Children's Hall sledding range that are suitable for 'convenient transportation' and 'low price'. I added the Seoul Plaza Skating Rink which adds a more romantic atmosphere (because winter nights in the city are beautiful). Let's go to Ttukseom Hangang Park sledding range first.

Transformation Ttukseom Han River Park Pool! Sledding Range in Winter!
Ttukseom Hangang Park Sledding Range is located in Ttukseom Hangang Park. You will see it immediately after exit 2 of Ttukseom Park Station. Based on the sledding grounds, it has a small play area such as a mini viking, an air bumper car and a room. There is also a winter celebrity, smelt fishing experience (4,000 won), which is perfect for a half-day playground. Yeouido sledding range which opened together did not open this year.
Low slopes are available for children
Ttukseom Hangang Park Sledding Range, which opened on December 18, is scheduled to operate until February 22. The original notice went out to February 15, but said it would extend the operating period to 22 days at the on-site ticket booth. Hours of operation are from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm on weekdays and weekends. There is no day off but may be temporarily adjusted in case of bad weather. The sledding playground will be closed for one hour every day from noon. Remember
Low slopes are available for children
Tickets for sledding ranges at 6,000 won, and free passes including the trampoline, bomber car, minibikes and electric cars are 10,000 won. Admission ticket for smelt fishing experience in the sledding range is 4000 won.
More fun with mom and dad!
Let's start with the sledding range. As it can be used for more than 36 months, it is equipped with a 30m small sledding range and an 80m large sledding range to prevent safety accidents. The small size is only available for under 6 years from 36 months. In addition, plastic sleds and tube sleds are available for various sled experiences.
More fun with mom and dad!
Adults like it more! Sledding Range next to Children's Grand Park!
Many people visited the smelt fishing experience area next to the sledding range. Only 10 can be caught at a time, but even those who haven't visited the smelt festival can enjoy catching smelt. The smelt from the smelt fishing experience field is taken to a shelter next to it and washed for 2000 won and then fried. Fish cakes and drinks are available. If you want to have a cup of tea while looking at the Han River after exciting sleds and smelt fishing, head to the Ttukseom Viewing Culture Complex. The sledding tour can be completed at a cultural retreat with a library and café.
Squid fishing without words!
The Children's Hall sledding range is not far from Ttukseom River Park sledding range. Located next to Children's Grand Park, it is also called Children's Grand Park Sledding Range. It also operates until February 22. Exit at Children's Grand Park Station (Line 7) and go straight 300m.
Squid fishing without words!
Children's Hall sledding range is 10,000 won and set ticket with smelt fishing experience is 15,000 won. Additional charges for Air Bumbercar (KRW 5,000), Euro address (KRW 5,000), and Viking (KRW 3000) are additional. It is open daily from 9:30 am to 5:00 pm, without opening. You must enter by no later than 4:00.
Freshly caught smelt can be fried immediately
There is also a gentle 80m course slope dedicated to children to prevent accidents. Mom and dad can use it with their children. There is also a sledding range for adults up to 120 meters in length, which is a great date course.
Freshly caught smelt can be fried immediately
Downtown night view is a bonus, Seoul Plaza Skating Rink
Seoul Square Skating Rink In winter, the plaza in front of the Seoul City Hall is reborn as an ice rink. It will be open until February 8, which will open on December 19. Hours are 10am to 9:30 pm (Sun-Thu) / 10am to 11pm (Saturday and Public Holidays).
The money needed to skate while enjoying the night view in the middle of downtown Seoul is 1,000 won. The price includes the skate rental fee. It will be open for 1 hour and then 30 minutes for maintenance from 10 am. 700 people each day. Internet and field booking are half and half. Skating on Namsan, you can decorate a date course where you can enjoy the night view. Enjoy it before winter
Seoul Square Skating Rink loved every winter

item.title: Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour
item.description:
Hannam-dong Back Alley Travel Map

Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

'Usadan-ro 10-gil', once located in Itaewon, once called the Liberation Village, has once again attracted the attention of the world. On the last Saturday of every month, we will visit the 10th Usadan-ro, Hannam-dong, a “warm town” in Seoul, which is being transformed into a forward base for small-business start-up as well as a space for artistic creation for young people.

Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro 10-gil, a young base for convergence and convergence of youth
Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro is less than 900 meters from Bogwang Elementary School to Cheongseok Super. Exit No. 3 of Itaewon Station (Line 6) and go up 100 meters to the '119 Safety Center' alley. Looking up from here, you can see two towers towering towards the sky. 'Seoul Central Masjid'. In front of the main entrance to the Islamic Masjid, the road that stretches in the direction of the Han River is Usadan.
Daytime in the Islamic Central Member of Seoul
If there were a lot of pear trees and it was called 'Itaewon (梨 泰 院)', 'Usadan-ro' came from the record that the altar 'Usadan' was built here for the rain festival during Taejong, Joseon Dynasty. Usadan-ro 10-gil is a favorite place for photographers because of the interruption of the redevelopment project. Let's take a look at what's going on.
Seoul Islamic Central Masquerade Night
It's hard to find an alley where Shingu is harmonious, like Usadan-ro 10-gil from Seoul.
Hanjin Barber Shop
From old-fashioned barbershops that use firewood as fuel, to radio stations, rice cakes, Pakistani and Turkish restaurants, the traditional market blends together, and the guest house, as well as a jewelry design shop using the latest technology.
50-year-old Barber Chair at Hanjin Barber Shop
Walking along this road, there are so many foreigners that I wonder if there are more foreigners than Koreans.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Not only the geographical features of Itaewon and Islam mosques, but also because of the old houses, the rent is cheap and the language and living environment are convenient.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Itaewon's famous staircase and “Come in store”
Here is a community that drives young desires and change. The young cultural artists 'Usadandan (雩 祀 壇 團)' combines interesting cultural contents and business with the young people traders. Since 2012, young people who live in the area and have business spaces such as workshops have been working together to create local culture and revitalize their business.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The most representative business is the free market called 'stair leader'. The staircase, which started on 63 steps next to a mosque last spring, has only 30 to 40 participants, but now it has become one of the representative flea markets in Seoul.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The stairs are open from 12 am to 6 am on the last Saturday of every month.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
It was originally held on 63 steps, less than 3 meters wide. Sellers can be assigned three stairs to sell.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
However, for the safety and convenience of many visitors to the stairs, the place is moved to 'Usadan-ro 10-gil'.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
The 'coming shops' with the catch phrase 'Come in because it's hot' on both sides of the street, and the temporary seller table installed in front of it, replace the stairs.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
One of the popular programs of 'Staircase-In Come' is 'Tongtong Tour', which explores local culture.
Plump Tour
You will wander through the alley for two hours and hear interesting stories about the history and culture of the area.
Tattoo drawing
The tour program, which starts at the central mosque and ends at the supermarket, is conducted by young local residents.
Seller's homemade basil pesto
As with any flea market, the most popular places are the gourmet foods, tattoo houses, and portrait shops, where you can draw a portrait in 10 seconds for 10 won.
Portrait that draws in 10 seconds for 10 won
Usadan-ro 10-gil, Itaewon, transforming into an artist studio and cultural spot
There are a growing number of shops on Usadan-gil, with unique attractions run by young Soho entrepreneurs and artists.
Suine's Snack Store Famous for Spicy Chicken Feet
In particular, the Potato House, which is run by youth traders, sells the popular concept of Potato and Beer.
A young merchant who is good at Sabah
In addition to trendy foods such as meals and snacks for lunch and dinner in the evenings, Sooky's Snack Shop, a spicy chicken restaurant popular with famous celebrities, is whether it's a snack bar or a bar. It's weird.
Sophisticated Yukgaejang
Chicken shops such as Song Elim Chicken, which are commonly found in the traditional world of 'Eating My World', offer chefs' menus that change every day.
Deep-fried brown chicken
There are a variety of cafes on Usadan-gil.
coffee
There are cafes in various forms, ranging from “today's opening” to “entropy” reminiscent of the laws of physics and “champs” reminiscent of boxing films.
Entropy
Champ is a roasting café operated by three brothers and made freshly roasted coffee beans to become a favorite coffee shop not only for the elderly, but also for young people. Down. 10 minutes patiently wait.
Champ Coffee
'It would have opened today' is a free-spirited cafe that the owner wants to open, but now it is open every day except Sundays.
I would have opened today
There are designer jewelery shops on both sides of the street, opened by young people with both dexterity and sense.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Young designers and makers work together to produce and display jewelry, bags, and accessories, which are made by giving off artistic artists.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Typical shops include MK Leather Work (handmade leather bracelet), 'World I live' (handmade metal workshop), 'Mind Mine' (design jewelry), 'Luciente' (homemade jewelry), Ampersand (classic leather accessory), ' Thy '(leather wallet, wooden glasses, watch),' The 7th Heaven '(silverwork),' J & J Works' (jeans recycling accessory), and Xia's emotional doll.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
They create beautiful props that bring youth and run experience classes.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
In addition, 'WORKS', which commissions and sells works produced by independent designers, 'Soul Ink', which combines an art tattoo shop and a graffiti exhibition hall, 'Kiss Gallery' with three works and a bench for viewing outside the window, Don't forget 'Art Recipe'.
Kiss pics
HAUS, a guest house for travelers, not only accepts guests in three rooms with bunk beds, but also serves as a local tourist information center and love room.
Guest House Haus
Tiger House has a well-viewed guest house famous for its bare tacos and polar beer.
Tiger House
Usadan-ro 10-gil ending at Dokkaebi Market and Supermarket
Entering the 'Dokkaebi Market', the road is divided into two parts. On the right side is the 'Cheongseok Super', the end of 10 roads in Usadan-ro. Follow the road on your left to 'Supermarket'. 'Supermarket' is a three-story building that is used as a café, small gatherings, parties, and dining venues by renovating an existing building.
Supermarket cafe
'Dokkaebi market' is a traditional market. When the crackdown of the ward office comes, it avoids it like a goblin.
Han River catches a glance at rooftop table

The characteristic of the shops that entered Usadanro is the creative space that made the old buildings with minimal remodeling. So some shops use old signs to confuse visitors. Nevertheless, due to the affection and passion of young artists and entrepreneurs, Usadan Street, which can turn into an unsafe crime alley, is transformed into an art creative street, and the streets of young people representing Seoul following Hongdae, Garosu-gil, etc. It is transformed into.

Dokebi Market
P.S.

On the late evening of Wednesday, four days after the staircase-incoming ceremony was held, I went back to the street. It's nine o'clock, and people are cut off and most shops are closed. English phrases written on the glass window reflecting the appearance of a few young people busy preparing to open a design office called “P.S.” touch the chest. “People all have names. Sometimes, things name people. We name things that already have names. Now, this could be the only name. ” “A person has a name, and sometimes things name a person. Even when there is a name for things, people call it again. ” In addition, I remember the title of poet Lee Kyung-ok's collection of poetry `` Road makes a way by walking. '' I wonder if we should walk on Usadan Road and call out its name to create the Usadan Street that young people dream of. And wishes.
